analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba 'di ni rtsom pa dang po pha la nges pa yin te /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba 'di ni rtsom pa dang po pha la nges pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe nine meditative attainments of successive abiding‚Äù is a rule for beginners.

original: 'dir ni bsam gtan dang po ma bskyed par ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dir ni bsam gtan dang po ma bskyed par ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: Here, one is unable to enter the second meditative attainment without first generating the first meditative attainment.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ma bskyed par 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ma bskyed par 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du mi nus so //
translated: Similarly, one is unable to enter meditative attainment that is the cessation of discriminations and feelings without first generating the meditative attainment of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination.

original: dga' mgur dbang ba ni phul du byung bar dbang ba nyid do //
analyzed: dga' mgur dbang ba ni phul du byung bar dbang ba nyid do //
translated: Having mastery over them means having mastery over the best.

original: rnam par brgal te yang snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba ni dang po nas gsum par ro //
analyzed: rnam par brgal te yang snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba ni dang po nas gsum par ro //
translated: They enter meditative attainment by skipping over means that they enter the third meditative attainment without first entering the second meditative attainment.

original: gsum pa nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: from the third, up to the sphere of infinite space.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las srid pa'i rtse mor phung po bzhi pa rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las srid pa'i rtse mor phung po bzhi pa rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The question is raised: ‚ÄúIn the attainment of cessation, in the summit of existence, there is a fourfold aggregate that is the nature of a ripened effect.‚Äù

original: tshe la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin sems dang lus la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mor yang gzugs med pa'i phyir sems med pa'i gnas skabs med do ;
analyzed: tshe la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin sems dang lus la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mor yang gzugs med pa'i phyir sems med pa'i gnas skabs med do ;
translated: Because life, etc., function in dependence on mind and body, there is no state without mind in the summit of existence, because there is no form there.

original: ; phung po gcig pa'i srid pa mi srid pa de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba med par mi 'os so //
analyzed: ; phung po gcig pa'i srid pa mi srid pa de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba med par mi 'os so //
translated: Since a single aggregate existence is impossible, it is not possible that there is no mind or mental factors.

original: ci ltar 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dhy'a no tyee /
analyzed: ci ltar 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dhy'a no tyee /
translated: Just as in the attainment of non-perception,

original: srid pa'i rtse mor yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa /üîΩra sam ga tya na nu brta te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa / ra sam ga tya na nu brta te /
translated: in the summit of existence, the attainment of cessationüîΩis the highest existence.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The question is raised: ‚ÄúIn the attainment of cessation, there is also perception, etc.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa nyid de'i sa pa'i rgyas par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa nyid de'i sa pa'i rgyas par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the level of the fourth absorption and the summit of existence because it is enhanced by those levels.

original: de'i mjug thogs su skyed par byed pa de yang mi rigs te /üîΩbi ts'a ri ni ya mi te /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su skyed par byed pa de yang mi rigs te / bi ts'a ri ni ya mi te /
translated: It is illogical that it is generated immediately after that,üîΩbecause it is not generated immediately after that.

original: de mi rigs te de ma thag tu bskyed pa med @227b pas de'i sa pa nyid kyi rgyur ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi rigs te de ma thag tu bskyed pa med @227b pas de'i sa pa nyid kyi rgyur ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is illogical because it would follow that it would be enhanced by that level, since it is not generated immediately after that.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained:

original: gal te bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mjug thogs su sems med pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par gyur na bsam gtan bzhi ba sngon du 'gro ba'i mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyid do ;
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mjug thogs su sems med pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par gyur na bsam gtan bzhi ba sngon du 'gro ba'i mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyid do ;
translated: If the mindless meditative attainment of cessation immediately follows the fourth absorption, then it is the meditative attainment of successive abiding preceded by the fourth absorption.

original: ; mthar gyis bskyed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'dir 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: ; mthar gyis bskyed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'dir 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since it is generated in succession, it is generated in this context.

original: de lta bu la gegs ci phyir mi 'ong bas bsam gtan bzhi ba'i snyoms bar 'jug pa'i mjug thogs su 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed ces bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu la gegs ci phyir mi 'ong bas bsam gtan bzhi ba'i snyoms bar 'jug pa'i mjug thogs su 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed ces bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe meditative attainment of cessation is generated at the conclusion of the fourth meditative stabilization‚Äù is a topic of dispute.

original: gang gi tshe 'di sems gcod pa dang rjes su mthun pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par de'i rgyu ba ches phra bar lam mngon par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di sems gcod pa dang rjes su mthun pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par de'i rgyu ba ches phra bar lam mngon par sgrub par byed de /
translated: When one is compatible with the cessation of mind and one establishes the path without manifest effort, one establishes the extremely subtle movement of that mind.

original: de thob nas mthar gyis 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi mtshan nyid sems gcod pa dran pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas sgrub par byed pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa srid pa'i rtse mo nyid sgrub byed
analyzed: de thob nas mthar gyis 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi mtshan nyid sems gcod pa dran pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas sgrub par byed pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa srid pa'i rtse mo nyid sgrub byed
translated: Having obtained that, one establishes the meditative attainment of cessation, which is the summit of existence, through the mindfulness that severs the mind that is characterized by the base of nothingness free from attachment to the base of nothingness and the summit of existence that is characterized by the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: do // de 'dod chags dang bral bas snyoms par 'jug pa'am mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams zhes bya ba de'i gnas skabs mdo dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'dir thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: do // de 'dod chags dang bral bas snyoms par 'jug pa'am mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams zhes bya ba de'i gnas skabs mdo dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'dir thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the consequence is that the meditative attainment of non-perception would also be virtuous.

original: de dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba gong ma'i 'dod chags bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba nges pa'o //
analyzed: de dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba gong ma'i 'dod chags bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba nges pa'o //
translated: It is definite that one who is free from attachment to the desire realm and the first absorption is not free from attachment to higher levels.üîΩThe two meditative attainments are like that.

original: de ltar snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste tshul ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste tshul ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The way is as it has been explained.

original: myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are definite to be experienced and both.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of non-perception is definite to be experienced.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnyis ka yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnyis ka yin te /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is both.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa yin gyi dgra bcom pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa yin gyi dgra bcom pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: Nonreturners are certain to experience it, but arhats are not,

original: de ni de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they attain nirvana in this life.

original: yang na skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba las gnyis @228a * //
analyzed: yang na skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba las gnyis @228a * //
translated: Or else, both karma to be experienced after rebirth and karma to be experienced in a third life

original: ka myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ka myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: are experienced.

original: dang po skyes pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la //
analyzed: dang po skyes pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la //
translated: The first is also experienced after rebirth.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni kha cig dang po mi dag gi nang du skyes pa /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni kha cig dang po mi dag gi nang du skyes pa /
translated: Some enter the meditative attainment of nondiscernment in the desire realm,

original: kha cig gis ni lha dag gi nang du'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni lha dag gi nang du'o //
translated: some in the form realm.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dang po mi dag gi nang kho nar skye la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dang po mi dag gi nang kho nar skye la /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is first generated only among humans,

original: yongs su nyams pas ni yang gzugs kyi khams su skye'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pas ni yang gzugs kyi khams su skye'o //
translated: but one who degenerates from it is reborn in the form realm.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dang po mi dag gi nang kho nar skye'i 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin gzugs kyi khams su ma yin zhe na /üîΩmnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang tshor ba'i sgo nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rab tu rgyu bas yo das su skyo bas phyir mi 'ong ba rnams 'gog pa la zhi bar gnas
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dang po mi dag gi nang kho nar skye'i 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin gzugs kyi khams su ma yin zhe na / mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang tshor ba'i sgo nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rab tu rgyu bas yo das su skyo bas phyir mi 'ong ba rnams 'gog pa la zhi bar gnas
translated: Why is this first generated only among humans and not in the form realm, like the meditative attainment of nondiscernment?üîΩBecause it is not equipoise, it is generated in the desire realm because nonreturners are weary of desire realm investigation and analysis that is, mental factors that are concomitant with discernment and feeling. They think, I will attain peace and abide in bliss by attaining the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: pas bde bar gnas par bya'o snyam pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnyed par byed cing yang yang sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: pas bde bar gnas par bya'o snyam pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnyed par byed cing yang yang sgrub par byed do //
translated: They attain the meditative attainment of cessation and repeatedly practice it.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni gzugs kyi khams mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung bas de ltar gnod par mi byed pas der dang por 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni gzugs kyi khams mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung bas de ltar gnod par mi byed pas der dang por 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par mi byed do //
translated: Nonreturners born in the form realm do not generate the meditative attainment of cessation there for the first time because they do not harm the mind and mental factors there since they possess the meditative attainment of the form realm.

original: bskyed zin pa yongs su nyams pa ni sngon goms pa'i dbang gis skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bskyed zin pa yongs su nyams pa ni sngon goms pa'i dbang gis skyed par byed do //
translated: But if they have previously generated it and it has degenerated, they generate it again through the power of former training.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la thar pa'i lam du 'du shes pa skyed par byed pas na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la thar pa'i lam du 'du shes pa skyed par byed pas na /
translated: They generate the conception that the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the path of liberation.

original: gzugs kyi khams su yang dang por de bskyed pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su yang dang por de bskyed pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore it is not contradictory that they generate it for the first time in the form realm.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pas ming 'jug pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pas ming 'jug pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ma mthong ste /
translated: Since they are similar in that they stop the mind and mental factors, no cause for applying the name meditative attainment of nondiscernment is seen.

original: 'dri pa ni /
analyzed: 'dri pa ni /
translated: The question is asked

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Why are they called meditative attainment?

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gnyis ka yang ming khyad par med par 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gnyis ka yang ming khyad par med par 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because there is no difference in the reason for the use of the term.

original: yang na sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yin yang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yin yang ci'i phyir /
translated: Or else, why is it that the nature of all minds and mental factors is cessation?

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dag gi bsnyad kyi @228b sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyi sa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dag gi bsnyad kyi @228b sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyi sa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Why is it called the cessation of ideation and sensation, and not the cessation of other minds and mental factors?

original: de dag dang mi mthun pas zhes pa ni 'du shes dang mi mthun pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas so //
analyzed: de dag dang mi mthun pas zhes pa ni 'du shes dang mi mthun pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas so //
translated: Because it is incompatible with them.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la sbyor ba ni de dag la snyoms par 'jug par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la sbyor ba ni de dag la snyoms par 'jug par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The preparation for these meditative attainments is the preparation for entering them.

original: de la 'du shes dang mi mthun pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor te /
analyzed: de la 'du shes dang mi mthun pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor te /
translated: One enters the attainment of non-ideation through incompatibility with ideation.

original: 'du shes ni nad yin no //üîΩ'du shes ni 'bras yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes ni nad yin no //üîΩ'du shes ni 'bras yin no //
translated: Ideation is a disease,üîΩa boil, a dart.

original: 'du shes ni zug rngu yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni zhi ba'o 'di ni gya nom pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni zug rngu yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni zhi ba'o 'di ni gya nom pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is peace, this is sublime, etc.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyar te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyar te /
translated: One is applied to the meditative attainment of cessation because it is incompatible with ideation and sensation.

original: gcig ni lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin la /
translated: The first is the basis of the defilement of afflicted views.

original: gnyis pa ni srid pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni srid pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: The second is the basis of the defilement of existence.

original: de'i phyir de dag dang mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dang mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, they are incompatible with these two.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the cognition of another's thoughts.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes par bya ba'i phyir de la rab tu sbyor bas na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes par bya ba'i phyir de la rab tu sbyor bas na /
translated: Because one is applied to the cognition of another's thoughts, it is called the cognition of another's thoughts.üîΩIt is not that it cognizes the factors such as sensation, etc.

original: de la gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'i des tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni shes pa ni ma yin te de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'i des tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni shes pa ni ma yin te de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: , in the same way, here.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams bskyed pa 'gog pas spangs pa thob pa'i phyir 'di dus mtshungs par 'jug pa can zhes bya ba ming dang 'dod pa sna tshogs kyi chos ston pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams bskyed pa 'gog pas spangs pa thob pa'i phyir 'di dus mtshungs par 'jug pa can zhes bya ba ming dang 'dod pa sna tshogs kyi chos ston pa mi rigs te /
translated: Since it stops the generation of concomitant phenomena, it is called the attainment of abandonment. It is illogical to teach various doctrines of names and assertions that operate simultaneously.

original: 'di rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las ma 'das par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: 'di rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las ma 'das par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: It would not transcend the group of consciousnesses.üîΩSome assert that the meditative attainment of cessation is the mere cessation of discernment, just as the meditative attainment of nonperception is the mere cessation of discernment.

original: 'ga' zhig 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du shes tsam 'gog pa nyid du 'dod pa ji lta bar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ste de dag pa ri h'ar manta re na mu khyee ba bri hy'a de dag
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du shes tsam 'gog pa nyid du 'dod pa ji lta bar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ste de dag pa ri h'ar manta re na mu khyee ba bri hy'a de dag
translated: They are called the meditative attainment of nonperception and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'du shes kyi 'jug pas mang po pa'i dbye ba rnams su khas blangs pas 'du shes dang tshor ba dag mang po par nges par khas lan par byed de /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi 'jug pas mang po pa'i dbye ba rnams su khas blangs pas 'du shes dang tshor ba dag mang po par nges par khas lan par byed de /
translated: Since they are accepted as the many divisions of the engagement of discernment, they definitely accept that discernment and feeling are the many.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang gnyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang gnyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They are like investigation, analysis, and sleep.

original: da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /üîΩgang gi phyir myu gu la sogs pa rgyu dang ldan pa rnams ni de ltar @229a * //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste / gang gi phyir myu gu la sogs pa rgyu dang ldan pa rnams ni de ltar @229a * //
translated: Because,

original: zhig nas yun ring du lon pa'i sa bon las skye ba ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhig nas yun ring du lon pa'i sa bon las skye ba ma mthong ngo //
translated: having been destroyed, sprouts and so on that possess a cause are not seen to arise from a seed that has long since ceased.

original: 'das pa yang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'das pa yang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Since the past exists,

original: gal te yod na ji ltar 'das pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod na ji ltar 'das pa yin zhe na /
translated: if it exists, how could it be past?

original: byed pa 'gags pa'i 'das pa zhes bya'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gtang ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa 'gags pa'i 'das pa zhes bya'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su gtang ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is called past because its activity has ceased, not because it has relinquished its own nature.

original: de'i phyir 'gags ma thag pa ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gags ma thag pa ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, like the just ceased, the past is also a similar immediately preceding condition, according to the Vaibhasikas.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pa sems la bzhag nas bye brag tu smra ba smos so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pa sems la bzhag nas bye brag tu smra ba smos so //
translated: The Vaibhasikas are mentioned because they posit the mind without positing foundation consciousness.

original: aa tra s'u yartham /
analyzed: aa tra s'u yartham /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: 'di gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes bya ba ni sems la yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi sa bon yod la /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes bya ba ni sems la yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi sa bon yod la /
translated: These two are seeds of each other.

original: lus la yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i sems kyi sa bon yod de /
analyzed: lus la yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i sems kyi sa bon yod de /
translated: The body has the seeds of consciousness and the sense faculties.

original: de ltar na gnyis ka phan tshun gyi sa bon can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis ka phan tshun gyi sa bon can yin no //
translated: Thus, both are seeds of each other.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ni sngon gyi mdo sde pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ni sngon gyi mdo sde pa rnams so //
translated: The former masters are the former SautrƒÅntikas.

original: gal te ris mthun pa'i rgyu la ma bltos par dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus las rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te ris mthun pa'i rgyu la ma bltos par dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus las rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin na /
translated: If consciousness arises from a body that possesses sense faculties without relying on a homogeneous cause,

original: rten dang dmigs pa cig car gnas pa na yul thams cad la rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa cig car gnas pa na yul thams cad la rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then when the support and object exist simultaneously, consciousness would arise with respect to all objects.

original: sems snga ma gang yin pa de la rag las pas sems phyi ma skye bas na gnyis pa la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pas rten dang dmigs pa yod kyang cig car mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems snga ma gang yin pa de la rag las pas sems phyi ma skye bas na gnyis pa la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pas rten dang dmigs pa yod kyang cig car mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the arising of subsequent consciousness depends on the prior consciousness, the consequence is that consciousness would not arise simultaneously even when the support and object exist, because the second moment would lack the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: gal te sems yod pa ma yin yang sems med pa'i dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi sa bon las so zhe na 'di yang mi rigs te khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te sems yod pa ma yin yang sems med pa'i dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi sa bon las so zhe na 'di yang mi rigs te khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that the body with its nonmental faculties is the seed, even though the mind does not exist, that is not correct, because there is no special cause.

original: yongs su dri ba las zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos de las so //
analyzed: yongs su dri ba las zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos de las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the treatise called the Paraprasiddhi‚Äù means in the treatise composed by him.

original: skyon du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyon du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is a fault‚Äù means:

original: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las yang sems skye bar 'gyur zhes gang sngar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las yang sems skye bar 'gyur zhes gang sngar brjod pa'o //
translated: Now, how can the mind arise again from a mind that has long ceased? This is what was said above.

original: 'gags nas ring du lon pa smos pa ni de ma thag pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags nas ring du lon pa smos pa ni de ma thag pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlong ceased‚Äù is used to exclude the immediately antecedent condition.

original: de ma thag 'gags pa las kyang skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ma thag 'gags pa las kyang skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable for the mind to arise from a mind that has just ceased.

original: 'gags pa @229b ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gags pa @229b ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no //
translated: Because a ceased mind does not exist, like a mind that has long ceased.

original: ci ste da ma thag pa 'gags //
analyzed: ci ste da ma thag pa 'gags //
translated: If you say that the mind arises from a mind that has just ceased,

original: gal te 'gags nas yun ring lon yang de ma thag 'gags pa bzhin de nyid kyi phyir skye ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gal te 'gags nas yun ring lon yang de ma thag 'gags pa bzhin de nyid kyi phyir skye ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: If it has long ceased, then it is like the immediately past, and therefore arising is not contradictory.

original: de ma thag 'gags pa ni yod pa nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ma thag 'gags pa ni yod pa nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: The immediately past is not accepted as existing.

original: de ma thag 'gags pa la brten nas 'jig pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems skye ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ma thag 'gags pa la brten nas 'jig pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems skye ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: The arising of the mind of the present state of destruction is not contradictory, in dependence on the immediately past.

original: de skyes pas de yang 'gag go zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de skyes pas de yang 'gag go zhes bya ste /
translated: When that arises, that also ceases.

original: de la btsun pa dbyig bshes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems dang bcas pa 'dod kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sems dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la btsun pa dbyig bshes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems dang bcas pa 'dod kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sems dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The Venerable Vasumitra asserts that the mind of the mental consciousness exists, but not the mind of the foundation consciousness.

original: de ni mi 'thad de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: That is not tenable.üîΩThe meditative attainment of cessation is not tenable as having a mind.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: The statement that the meditative attainment of cessation has a mind is not tenable.

original: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The three meeting is contact. The three are the sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Feeling conditioned by contact, and so on.

original: gegs byed pa med pa'i rgyu yod na 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag kyang 'gog par mi 'gyur te reg pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gegs byed pa med pa'i rgyu yod na 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag kyang 'gog par mi 'gyur te reg pa bzhin no //
translated: If the cause of the absence of obstruction exists, then the result will definitely occur. Therefore, the substance of the meditative attainment of cessation would not stop discernment and feeling, just as contact is not stopped.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If you say that contact exists in the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa thams cad yin gyi /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa thams cad yin gyi /
translated: then all feeling, discernment, and intention would exist there.

original: reg pa thams cad ni tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen ma yin pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par reg pa rkyen yod pas 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag mi dgag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa thams cad ni tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen ma yin pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par reg pa rkyen yod pas 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag mi dgag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But not all contact is the condition of feeling and so on, because the meditative attainment of cessation would not stop feeling and so on, since contact would be a condition there.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pas gnas skabs de 'thob pas gnas skabs de na reg pa yod kyang /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pas gnas skabs de 'thob pas gnas skabs de na reg pa yod kyang /
translated: You attain that state through aversion to discernment and feeling, but even though contact exists in that state,

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba dag gi rkyen nyid bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba dag gi rkyen nyid bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: The condition of perception and feeling cannot be established.

original: de nyid la dpe ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dpe ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The example is the same as in the case of the statement, ‚ÄúCraving has the condition of feeling.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'du shes dang sems pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'du shes dang sems pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: ‚Äù The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúfeeling, etc.‚Äù refers to perception and intention.

original: khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes bya ba la /üîΩtshor ba bzhin du reg pa thams cad tshor ba'i @230a * //
analyzed: khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes bya ba la / tshor ba bzhin du reg pa thams cad tshor ba'i @230a * //
translated: It is not because they are distinguished.

original: rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that all contact is not the condition of feeling, as it is for feeling.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mdo gzhan las tshor ba khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las tshor ba khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because feeling is distinguished in another s≈´tra.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarisen from contact associated with ignorance‚Äù is explained in detail.

original: ma rig pa dang 'brel ba'i reg pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'brel ba'i reg pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Contact associated with ignorance is contact associated with ignorance.

original: ma rag pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rag pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Contact that is not associated with ignorance is that which arises from contact associated with ignorance.

original: de ltar sred pa skye ba la tshor ba ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa nyid kyi khyad par byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sred pa skye ba la tshor ba ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa nyid kyi khyad par byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the distinction that feeling arises from contact associated with ignorance is not made in the statement that craving arises in dependence on feeling.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa med pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya bar sgrub par mi nus so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa med pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya bar sgrub par mi nus so ;
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to establish that feeling that is not associated with ignorance is the condition for craving.

original: / tshor ba skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩreg pa 'di 'dra ba ni tshor ba'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: / tshor ba skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / reg pa 'di 'dra ba ni tshor ba'i rkyen yin la /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúFeeling is the condition for craving, not for all feeling,‚Äù

original: 'di 'dra ba ni ma yin zhes bye brag tu ma byas te /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni ma yin zhes bye brag tu ma byas te /
translated: it is not specified that this kind of contact is the condition for feeling and that kind is not.

original: de'i phyir bye brag med par nye bar blangs pa'i phyir reg pa thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen yin pas dpe 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag med par nye bar blangs pa'i phyir reg pa thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen yin pas dpe 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since contact is accepted without distinction, all contact is the condition for feeling. This example is not analogous.

original: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'du shes dang tshor ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i rkyen gyi rnam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'du shes dang tshor ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i rkyen gyi rnam pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say, etc.

original: de dag gis reg pa bskyed cing rtog pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhin no zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gis reg pa bskyed cing rtog pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhin no zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs argument: ‚ÄúDiscernment and feeling are not conditions for meditative attainment because they generate contact, like the fourth meditation that is free from conceptualization.‚Äù

original: 'di yang 'di nyid kyis so sor bshad de /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di nyid kyis so sor bshad de /
translated: This is also explained individually by the following.

original: 'on kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji skad du /
translated: But how is it said:

original: tshor ba gang yin pa dang / sems gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa 'dres pa'i chos 'di dag gi ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba 'di 'gal te de ltar na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang sems 'dres pa'i nges pa mdor byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba gang yin pa dang / sems gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa 'dres pa'i chos 'di dag gi ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba 'di 'gal te de ltar na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang sems 'dres pa'i nges pa mdor byas pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe feeling that exists, the thought that exists, the discernment that exists, and the consciousness that exists‚Äîthese mixed phenomena are said to be unmixed. This is contradictory. Thus, conceptualization and investigation are not definitely condensed in the mind.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin sems dang bcas pa dge ba ni sems dang sems las byung brtse gcig par bsgrub pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa nyid du rung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams te 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems dang bcas pa dge ba ni sems dang sems las byung brtse gcig par bsgrub pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa nyid du rung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams te 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is asked with the intention that wholesome concentration together with mind is suitable to enter meditative attainment because it establishes a single entity of mind and mental factors, but not otherwise.

original: ji ltar na sems med pa snyoms par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na sems med pa snyoms par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How can meditative attainment be without mind?

original: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to establish the equality of the great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang mi mthun par gnas pa ste bsgrub pa ni de ltar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang mi mthun par gnas pa ste bsgrub pa ni de ltar byed pa'o //
translated: The equality of the great elements is the state of abiding in opposition to the arising of mind and mental factors. Establishment is the act of doing that.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kho na 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kho na 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
translated: The mind of preparation for meditative attainment establishes the equality of the great elements.

original: lus dang sems dag phan tshun @230b mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems dag phan tshun @230b mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because body and mind mutually assist each other.

original: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can nyid yin te /
translated: Others say: The sameness of the great elements is the state of being undestroyed.

original: 'di ltar 'gag pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gag pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: Thus the meditative attainment of cessation is the state of being undestroyed.

original: yang na sems kyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na sems kyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Or, one enters meditative attainment on that meditative attainment of the cessation of mind because it is the meditative attainment of the cessation of mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang sems gnyis lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang sems gnyis lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: If the mind and meditative attainment are contradictory, how can one enter meditative attainment?

original: de'i phyir thob par 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thob par 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúbecause one obtains it.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'dren pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'dren pa yin no //
translated: Thus the mind that prepares to enter meditative attainment induces the meditative attainment of the cessation of mind and mental factors.

original: sems skye ba las gegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems skye ba las gegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it obstructs the arising of the mind.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni chu 'bab pa la chu lon ltar dus gzhan gyi bar du sems skye ba la gegs byed pa zhig ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni chu 'bab pa la chu lon ltar dus gzhan gyi bar du sems skye ba la gegs byed pa zhig ste /
translated: Because the meditative attainment of cessation is like a dam that blocks the arising of minds for a period of time.

original: med pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gegs byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gegs byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could a non-existent state block the arising of minds?

original: 'jug bzhin pa'i sems mi 'jug pa ni rgyu bde ba'am /
analyzed: 'jug bzhin pa'i sems mi 'jug pa ni rgyu bde ba'am /
translated: The non-arising of an engaging mind is due to the condition of a cause that is either the bliss of meditative attainment or

original: de 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir rkyen nye ba las yin grang /
analyzed: de 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir rkyen nye ba las yin grang /
translated: the condition of the proximity of that which is incompatible with its engagement.

original: de re zhig rgyu zad pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de re zhig rgyu zad pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not due to the exhaustion of the cause, because

original: yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it arises again.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs la /
translated: Therefore it is understood that it is produced by another condition that is incompatible with it.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen gang yin pa de yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen gang yin pa de yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin na /
translated: And if that which is a condition incompatible with it is the meditative attainment of cessation,üîΩthen how could it be non-existent?

original: ma yin te snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho nas de la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa de'i tshe sems mi 'jug pa ni bden na 'gal ba'i rkyen de ni sems gzhan skye ba dang 'gal ba snyoms par
analyzed: ma yin te snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho nas de la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa de'i tshe sems mi 'jug pa ni bden na 'gal ba'i rkyen de ni sems gzhan skye ba dang 'gal ba snyoms par
translated: No, because the mind of meditative attainment itself obstructs the arising of other minds.

original: 'jug pa'i sems kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: When the mind does not arise due to other conditions that are incompatible with it, it is true that it does not arise, but the condition that is incompatible with the arising of another mind is the mind of meditative attainment itself, not anything else.

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu las sems 'jug pa rnam par chad par yang mi rigs la /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu las sems 'jug pa rnam par chad par yang mi rigs la /
translated: It is illogical for the mind to engage due to a cause of engagement and then cease engaging.

original: sems kyang 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sems kyang 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: And the mind is the cause of engagement.

original: de phyir mar me la rlung ltar sems la yang mi 'jug pa'i rgyu gzhan kho na zhig khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de phyir mar me la rlung ltar sems la yang mi 'jug pa'i rgyu gzhan kho na zhig khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, like a lamp in the wind, you should accept that there is another cause of the mind not engaging.

original: de'i phyir de dang 'gal ba'i rten bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang 'gal ba'i rten bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚Äúbecause it generates a basis that is incompatible with it.‚Äù

original: sems skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: sems skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: It means because it generates a basis that is incompatible with the arising of the mind.

original: mar me sdong bu la rag las pa ltar sems 'jug pa ni rten la rag las te /
analyzed: mar me sdong bu la rag las pa ltar sems 'jug pa ni rten la rag las te /
translated: The mind is dependent on its basis, just as a lamp is dependent on its handle.

original: de'i phyir rten nyams pas sems mi 'jug par mi @231a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten nyams pas sems mi 'jug par mi @231a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory that the mind does not engage because its basis is damaged.

original: 'gal lo // rten nyams pa de ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byed de de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: 'gal lo // rten nyams pa de ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byed de de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes de skad du bshad do //
translated: The mind of meditative attainment damages the basis, and therefore it is said that the mind of meditative attainment alone is the obstruction to that.

original: de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is called meditative attainment?

original: sems mi 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: sems mi 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags so //
translated: The nonengagement of mind is designated as meditative attainment.

original: de gdags pa'i nye bar lan pa po gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de gdags pa'i nye bar lan pa po gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the basis of its designation?

original: nye bar len pa med pa ni cung zad kyang btags pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa ni cung zad kyang btags pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Without appropriation, nothing at all is designated.

original: sems gang dag mi 'jug pa de dag de mi 'jug pa'i nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gang dag mi 'jug pa de dag de mi 'jug pa'i nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: Those minds that do not engage are the appropriation of that nonengagement.

original: gal te ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa de dag ji ltar na btags pa'i nye bar len par rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa de dag ji ltar na btags pa'i nye bar len par rung zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist because they are unarisen, how can they be suitable as the basis of designation?

original: ma 'ongs pa yin yang sems la gnas pa de dag ni mi 'jug pa'i nye bar len pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yin yang sems la gnas pa de dag ni mi 'jug pa'i nye bar len pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: But those that exist in the mind, even though future, are asserted to be the appropriated of non-arising.üîΩFor example,

original: dper na / rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
analyzed: dper na / rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
translated: When perfect buddhas do not appear

original: nyan thos rnams kyang zad pa na //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang zad pa na //
translated: and when ≈õrƒÅvakas have ceased,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
translated: the wisdom of pratyekabuddhas

original: brten pa med pa rab tu 'byung //üîΩzhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: brten pa med pa rab tu 'byung // zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: arises without dependence.

original: der ni sangs rgyas ma 'ongs pa blo la gnas pa rnams kho na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: der ni sangs rgyas ma 'ongs pa blo la gnas pa rnams kho na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Here, only future buddhas that exist in the mind do not arise.

original: ma skyes pa'i sangs rgyas ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i sangs rgyas ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that buddhas who have not arisen exist.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang zhig cing blo la gnas pa rnams kho na zad par brjod kyi da ltar ba rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang zhig cing blo la gnas pa rnams kho na zad par brjod kyi da ltar ba rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, it is said that ≈õrƒÅvakas who have ceased and exist in the mind have ceased, but not those who exist in the present.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin yang zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag blo la gnas pa kho na btags pa'i nye bar len pa yin par mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin yang zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag blo la gnas pa kho na btags pa'i nye bar len pa yin par mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, even though the past and future do not exist, it is not contradictory to say that only that which has ceased and that which has not arisen but exists in the mind is the appropriated of designation.

original: gal te snyoms par 'jug pa ma 'ongs pa'i sems mi 'jug pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: gal te snyoms par 'jug pa ma 'ongs pa'i sems mi 'jug pa tsam yin la /
translated: If meditative attainment is merely the nonarising of future minds,

original: de yang dngos po med pa yin pas 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dngos po med pa yin pas 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then since it is a nonentity, it would be an unconditioned state.üîΩTo respond: Therefore it is said,

original: de'i phyir mi 'jug pa tsam de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'jug pa tsam de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: that nonarising is also a conditioned state.üîΩHere, in terms of what is it said that conditioned states are merely the nonarising of future minds?üîΩThere is not the slightest establishment of conditioned states as mere nonarising.

original: 'dir gang gi dbang du byas nas 'dus byas zhes brjod pa mi 'jug pa tsam zhes bya ba 'dus byas grub par 'gyur ba ni cung zad kyang med kyi 'on kyang snyoms par 'jug pa sngon dang phyis med pas mi 'jug pa tsam gyis snyoms par 'jug paüîΩla 'dus byas su gdags so //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi dbang du byas nas 'dus byas zhes brjod pa mi 'jug pa tsam zhes bya ba 'dus byas grub par 'gyur ba ni cung zad kyang med kyi 'on kyang snyoms par 'jug pa sngon dang phyis med pas mi 'jug pa tsam gyis snyoms par 'jug paüîΩla 'dus byas su gdags so //
translated: However, meditative attainment is designated as a conditioned state by the mere nonarising of meditative attainment that does not exist before or after.

original: yang na rten nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la sngar ni tha snyad kyi sgo nas sems mi 'jug pa tsam snyoms par mi 'jug pa nyid yin pa dang / 'dus byas nyid du bshad la da lta ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan @231b thob pa'i rten nyid snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rten nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la sngar ni tha snyad kyi sgo nas sems mi 'jug pa tsam snyoms par mi 'jug pa nyid yin pa dang / 'dus byas nyid du bshad la da lta ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan @231b thob pa'i rten nyid snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: But now it is explained that meditative attainment is the basis itself that obtains another state through the power of meditative attainment.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas kyi rdzas yod pa ma yin yang snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas kyi rdzas yod pa ma yin yang snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, although it is not a substantially existent conditioned state from the ultimate perspective, it is explained as meditative attainment.

original: 'du shes med pa pa yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: The state of nondiscernment is also like that.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa btags pa tsam yin pa de bzhin du 'du shes med pa pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa btags pa tsam yin pa de bzhin du 'du shes med pa pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as the meditative attainment of cessation is a mere designation, so too is the state of nondiscernment.

original: rnal 'byor pa la ni de'i smon lam gyis 'phen pa'i shugs las snyoms par 'jug pa 'phangs pa chad na yid dang chos dag la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la ni de'i smon lam gyis 'phen pa'i shugs las snyoms par 'jug pa 'phangs pa chad na yid dang chos dag la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye la /
translated: For yogis, when the impetus of meditative attainment projected by the power of their aspiration is severed, mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mind and phenomena.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'phen pa zad pas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'phen pa zad pas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But those in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment die when the projection of the maturational result of karma is exhausted.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dag bstan zin to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dag bstan zin to //
translated: This completes the explanation of the meditative attainments.

original: srog ni tshe yin /
analyzed: srog ni tshe yin /
translated: Life force is lifespan.

original: 'di rnam grangs brjod pa yin gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te bstan bcos las bstan pa'i ngor byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnam grangs brjod pa yin gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te bstan bcos las bstan pa'i ngor byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is a synonym, not a definition, because it is stated in terms of the Abhidharma treatise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las 'di skad du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las 'di skad du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says in the Abhidharma:

original: rnam grangs ni grub na mtshan nyid byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: rnam grangs ni grub na mtshan nyid byed pa yin no ;
translated: Synonyms are used when the definition is established.

original: ;'di ni srog dang 'dra bar grub pas 'dis srog gi don nges par mi nus te de'i phyir tshe zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ;'di ni srog dang 'dra bar grub pas 'dis srog gi don nges par mi nus te de'i phyir tshe zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Since this is established as being like life, it cannot definitely be the meaning of life. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is this phenomenon called life?‚Äù

original: drod dang ni rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba de 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: drod dang ni rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba de 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: Heat and consciousness are the supports of life. This is explained from the perspective of the result.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The cause of duration is the support. This is the explanation.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te ji srid du tshe yod pa de srid du 'di gnyis rgyun chags su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te ji srid du tshe yod pa de srid du 'di gnyis rgyun chags su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: This is taught: As long as life exists, these two operate continuously.

original: da ni tshe'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni tshe'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now, the phrase ‚Äúthe support of life‚Äù occurs. The meaning is, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of duration?‚Äù

original: drod dang rnam par shes pa de dag nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste tshe ni de dag la rag las te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drod dang rnam par shes pa de dag nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste tshe ni de dag la rag las te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose two, heat and consciousness‚Äù occurs. Life is supported by them.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then the phrase ‚Äúthe support of life‚Äù occurs. The meaning is, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of duration?‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthose two, heat and consciousness‚Äù occurs. Life is supported by them.

original: gang dag la phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa yod pa de dag ni phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag la phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa yod pa de dag ni phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those that exist in mutual dependence are mutually dependent.

original: de'i dngos po ni phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa nyid de phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa nyid de phan tshun bltos te 'jug pa ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of that is the state of mutual dependence. Mutual dependence is the reason for that.

original: de dag las ni drod dang rnam par shes pa dang tshe gsum las so //
analyzed: de dag las ni drod dang rnam par shes pa dang tshe gsum las so //
translated: From among those, it is the three: heat, consciousness, and life force.

original: gang zhig sngar ldog par 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang zhig sngar ldog par 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Which one would cease first?

original: tshe ma ldog par gzhan dag ldog pa med la gzhan dag ldog pa med par yang tshe ldog pa med do //
analyzed: tshe ma ldog par gzhan dag ldog pa med la gzhan dag ldog pa med par yang tshe ldog pa med do //
translated: Without the life force ceasing, the others do not cease, and without the others ceasing, the life force does not cease.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: de ltar na rtag tu ldog pa med par thal @232a * //üîΩbar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rtag tu ldog pa med par thal @232a * // bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it would follow that they would never cease.

original: de'i phyir de dag phan tshun nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag phan tshun nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore they are not mutually dependent.

original: 'o na ni tshe'i rten du gyur pa ni las yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni tshe'i rten du gyur pa ni las yin gyi /
translated: But karma is the basis of life force,

original: drod dang rnam par shes pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: drod dang rnam par shes pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: not heat and consciousness.

original: de lta na las kyis 'phen pa zad pas ldog tshe la /
analyzed: de lta na las kyis 'phen pa zad pas ldog tshe la /
translated: Thus, when the life force ceases, it ceases due to the exhaustion of the projection by karma.

original: de log pas drod dang rnam par shes pa dag ldog pas rtag tu ldog pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log pas drod dang rnam par shes pa dag ldog pas rtag tu ldog pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it ceases due to the cessation of that, it is not the case that heat and consciousness always cease without cause.üîΩHow is karma the support of life?

original: ci ltar las tshe'i rten du gyur pa yin zhe na de'i phyir las kyis ji srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ci ltar las tshe'i rten du gyur pa yin zhe na de'i phyir las kyis ji srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it continues for as long as it is projected by karma.‚Äù

original: de rjes su 'jug pa ni las kyis 'phen pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: de rjes su 'jug pa ni las kyis 'phen pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: That continuation is caused by the projection of karma.üîΩWhy not accept that karma alone is the support of heat and consciousness?

original: drod dang rnam par shes pa dag gi rten du gyur pa yang las kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de srog gi dbang po dang cig car skye ba'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: drod dang rnam par shes pa dag gi rten du gyur pa yang las kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de srog gi dbang po dang cig car skye ba'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because the faculty of life force and the faculty of touch arise simultaneously and because they cease simultaneously.

original: ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: All consciousnesses up to the time of death

original: rnam par shes pa las kyis ji srid 'phangs pa de srid du rjes su 'jug pa'i srog ltar las kyi rten can du 'gyur na ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las kyis ji srid 'phangs pa de srid du rjes su 'jug pa'i srog ltar las kyi rten can du 'gyur na ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang /
translated: Consciousness is the basis of karma, like life force, because it is propelled by karma for a certain period of time.

original: sbrul pa pa thams cad srog bzhin du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrul pa pa thams cad srog bzhin du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If consciousness were to ripen, then until death, all consciousnesses virtuous, afflicted, the state of composure that is a cessation, the state of composure that is a nonperception, the state of composure without conception, and the consciousness of an intermediate being would ripen.

original: 'o na drod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: 'o na drod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: If you say that heat is the basis of karma,

original: srog gi dbang po dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i do bor 'gal ba med pas /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i do bor 'gal ba med pas /
translated: then there is no contradiction in saying that karma is the basis of heat, because heat arises and ceases simultaneously with the faculty of life force and because it is neutral.

original: drod kyi rten tu gyur pa ni las yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //üîΩdrod med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la drod ni me'i khams yin na /
analyzed: drod kyi rten tu gyur pa ni las yin par 'gyur ro // de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo // drod med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la drod ni me'i khams yin na /
translated: If you say that heat is the basis of karma,üîΩthen consciousness would not be the basis of karma, because it is not the basis of heat.üîΩIf you say that heat is the basis of karma,

original: 'byung ba dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then heat would not be the basis of consciousness, because it is not the basis of heat.üîΩIf you say that heat is the basis of karma,üîΩthen heat would not be the basis of consciousness, because it is not the basis of heat.

original: drod med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i rten ni las yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drod med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i rten ni las yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is devoid of heat, the basis of that formless-realm consciousness would be karma.

original: gang la lar ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang la lar ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In some places, etc.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sgo nas 'brel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sgo nas 'brel ba ma yin te /
translated: The nature of things as cause and effect is not related through desire, because it is due to the nature of cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'khrul pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'khrul pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in all cases, the nature of cause and effect is never in error.

original: bshad zin to zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: We have already explained this.

original: srog bzhin du rnam par @232b shes pa las la brten pa nyid min na ni /
analyzed: srog bzhin du rnam par @232b shes pa las la brten pa nyid min na ni /
translated: If consciousness did not rely on life force,

original: gzugs med pa dag na rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then afflicted and virtuous consciousness would not exist in the formless realm.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: tshe ni gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba mtha' dag gi rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: tshe ni gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba mtha' dag gi rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Life force is the result of a single action, but it is not the result of the action that generates birth in a particular realm.

original: las ni rten no //üîΩdrod gcig tu rnam par smin pa 'du shes sam ming sam dzny'am no nam gnyi ga ltar yang ma yin bha ya th'a /
analyzed: las ni rten no // drod gcig tu rnam par smin pa 'du shes sam ming sam dzny'am no nam gnyi ga ltar yang ma yin bha ya th'a /
translated: Action is the support.üîΩThe support of consciousness is action, because it is the cause of the stream.üîΩThe support of consciousness is not heat, because heat is the effect of action.

original: gang du yang skye ba mtha' dag gi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du yang skye ba mtha' dag gi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the two together, because the stream of consciousness does not occur everywhere.

original: der yang las las skyes pa kho na'o //üîΩde'i rten ni las so //
