analyzed: de la las kyi dus yongs su gzung ba dang rgyun nges pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in apprehending the time of karma and the continuity of karma.

original: gang yang dpe ston pa rnams ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: gang yang dpe ston pa rnams ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod pas /
translated: Also, those who teach the analogy do not assert foundation consciousness.

original: de dag gzugs med par skye ba'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor rjes su 'gro ba 'dra bar rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin de dang ris mthun par
analyzed: de dag gzugs med par skye ba'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor rjes su 'gro ba 'dra bar rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin de dang ris mthun par
translated: The virtuous, afflicted, and uncontaminated consciousnesses of those born in the formless realm are posited as similar to the maturational consciousness that is the nature of the cause of its maturation.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i phyogs bstan par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i phyogs bstan par byed do //
translated: They are posited as similar to the maturational consciousness.

original: ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa srog ces bshad pas sngon gyi srid pa'i rnam par shes pa der thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa srog ces bshad pas sngon gyi srid pa'i rnam par shes pa der thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is explained that life force is the impelling force of the time of abiding in a homogeneous existence, it is not the case that the consciousness of the prior existence is the consciousness of the intermediate existence.

original: ris mthun pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i srid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i srid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Since it is included in homogeneous existence, it is not uncontaminated existence,

original: srid pas bdag gir byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pas bdag gir byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence is appropriated by it.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di skad du tshe rdzas gzhan kho na gcig yod do zhes ni brjod do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di skad du tshe rdzas gzhan kho na gcig yod do zhes ni brjod do //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is said that there is a separate substance called life force.

original: srog gi dbang po de nyid lus kho na la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po de nyid lus kho na la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: That faculty of life force does not operate in dependence on the body alone.

original: gzugs med pa rnams su yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams su yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the formless realm.

original: sems kho na dang yang ma yin te sems med pa rnams la yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kho na dang yang ma yin te sems med pa rnams la yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not just the mind, because it continues to exist even when the mind is absent.

original: 'o na de'i 'phen par byed pa'i las snga ma dang da ltar ba'i ris mthun pa dag kyang ci /
analyzed: 'o na de'i 'phen par byed pa'i las snga ma dang da ltar ba'i ris mthun pa dag kyang ci /
translated: What then is the prior and present action that impels it?

original: gal te ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus 'phen pa'i las tshe yin na /
analyzed: gal te ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus 'phen pa'i las tshe yin na /
translated: If the action that impels the duration of a life-stream is life,üîΩthen why is there no interruption?

original: ci ltar bar mi chod ces bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: ci ltar bar mi chod ces bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is a statement of the opponent‚Äôs argument.

original: lo tog rnams smin pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa bzhin bar chad kyang stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lo tog rnams smin pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa bzhin bar chad kyang stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the time of the ripening of crops is projected, the time of death is projected by the power of the action that impels the life-stream.

original: gang zhig yod pa ma yin pa da la yang re zhig 'phen pa rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa ma yin pa da la yang re zhig 'phen pa rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Even when there is no life, the impelling of the life-stream continues.

original: de bzhin kho nar zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ma yin par nges pa'i don du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ma yin par nges pa'i don du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just so means that it should be stated with the definite meaning that it is not otherwise.

original: 'on te gzhan du yang yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du yang yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is otherwise, then what?

original: tshe yang rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis yin zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: tshe yang rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis yin zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that life is also a different cause.

original: btags pa las zhes bya ba @234b 'dis ni tshe yod kyang 'chi ba yod de zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: btags pa las zhes bya ba @234b 'dis ni tshe yod kyang 'chi ba yod de zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the exhaustion of the life force‚Äù indicates that death occurs even when life still remains.

original: dang po ni tshe'i rnam par smin pa can yin gyi longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can ma yin te las kyis 'phangs pa'i srog gi dbang po rgyun yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir tshe'i rnam par smin pa can gyi las yongs su gtugs pa yin no ;
analyzed: dang po ni tshe'i rnam par smin pa can yin gyi longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can ma yin te las kyis 'phangs pa'i srog gi dbang po rgyun yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir tshe'i rnam par smin pa can gyi las yongs su gtugs pa yin no ;
translated: The first type of death is due to the exhaustion of the karma that matures as life, but not due to the exhaustion of the karma that matures as resources, because the continuum of the vitality faculty that was projected by karma is completely exhausted.

original: ; gnyis pa ni longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can no //üîΩlas yongs su gtugs pa las so zhes bya bar sbyar te tshe'i rnam par smin pa can ni ma yin te gsum pa ni gnyis ka'o //
analyzed: ; gnyis pa ni longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can no // las yongs su gtugs pa las so zhes bya bar sbyar te tshe'i rnam par smin pa can ni ma yin te gsum pa ni gnyis ka'o //
translated: The second type of death is due to the exhaustion of the karma that matures as resources.üîΩThe third type of death is due to the exhaustion of both types of karma.

original: tshe dang longs spyod rnam par smin pa can dag ste /
analyzed: tshe dang longs spyod rnam par smin pa can dag ste /
translated: The fourth type of death is due to the exhaustion of neither type of karma.

original: las yongs su zad pa las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: las yongs su zad pa las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The fifth type of death is due to the exhaustion of both types of karma.

original: bzhi pa ni tshe dang longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can las ngag ma zad kyang yang ba yongs su mi spong bas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni tshe dang longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can las ngag ma zad kyang yang ba yongs su mi spong bas so //
translated: The fourth alternative is the case where the maturation of action that should produce life does not produce it, but the maturation of action that should produce resources does produce it.

original: bag med pa spyod pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bag med pa spyod pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The text has ‚Äúby the practice of heedlessness,‚Äù but it should have ‚Äúby the practice of heedfulness.‚Äù

original: mar me bzhin te /
analyzed: mar me bzhin te /
translated: Like a lamp.

original: ji ltar mar me ni res 'ga' snying po zad pa nyid las 'gags la /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me ni res 'ga' snying po zad pa nyid las 'gags la /
translated: Sometimes a lamp is extinguished by the exhaustion of its wick,

original: res 'ga' ni 'bru mar zad pa nyid las yin gyi snying po zad pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'bru mar zad pa nyid las yin gyi snying po zad pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: sometimes by the exhaustion of its oil, but not by the exhaustion of its flame.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyis ka zad pa las res 'ga' ni gnyis ka yod kyang rlung la sogs pas so //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyis ka zad pa las res 'ga' ni gnyis ka yod kyang rlung la sogs pas so //
translated: Sometimes it is extinguished by the exhaustion of both wick and oil, and sometimes by the wind, even though both are present.

original: tshe btang ba las kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe btang ba las kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same is true of the exhaustion of life.

original: brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that the exhaustion of life is the cause of death.

original: mu dang po'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu dang po'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is included in the first alternative.

original: de'i tshe rnam par smin pa can gyi las gang yin pa de longs spyod kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur pas tshe zad pa kho nas 'chi ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par smin pa can gyi las gang yin pa de longs spyod kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur pas tshe zad pa kho nas 'chi ba yin no //
translated: At that time, the action that should produce life produces resources instead.

original: tshe zad na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: tshe zad na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If life is exhausted, then one dies from the exhaustion of both.

original: longs spyod zad na tshe zad pa yang ldog nas longs spyod zad pas 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa yod na tshe zad na bzlog par bya ba'i phyir longs spyod zad pa 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod zad na tshe zad pa yang ldog nas longs spyod zad pas 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa yod na tshe zad na bzlog par bya ba'i phyir longs spyod zad pa 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa de'i phyir /
translated: If the exhaustion of resources can prevent death when life is exhausted, then the exhaustion of resources would have the power to cause death when life is exhausted.üîΩTherefore, the third alternative, death from the exhaustion of both, is illogical.

original: gnyis ka zad pa las zhes bya ba'i mu gsum pa mi rigs te de'i phyir srid pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyis ka zad pa las 'chi bar bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis ka zad pa las zhes bya ba'i mu gsum pa mi rigs te de'i phyir srid pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyis ka zad pa las 'chi bar bshad de /
translated: Therefore, death from the exhaustion of both is explained in terms of cyclic existence,

original: tshe zad nas bsod nams zad pa las 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe zad nas bsod nams zad pa las 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but death from the exhaustion of life when merit is exhausted does not have the power to cause death.

original: de lta mod kyi de'i phyir gnyis ka zad pas 'chi ba yod pas gnyis ka zad pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de'i phyir gnyis ka zad pas 'chi ba yod pas gnyis ka zad pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: However, since death from the exhaustion of both does exist, it is explained as death from the exhaustion of both.

original: yang tshe zad nas bsod nams zad pa las 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang tshe zad nas bsod nams zad pa las 'chi bar bya ba la nus pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But death from the exhaustion of life when merit is exhausted does not have the power to cause death.

original: tshe zad pa las kyang 'chi ba la bsod nams zad pa'i bya ba de med de /
analyzed: tshe zad pa las kyang 'chi ba la bsod nams zad pa'i bya ba de med de /
translated: Death also occurs when life is exhausted, but not when merit is exhausted.

original: phan tshun med kyang 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: phan tshun med kyang 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: The basis of the dispute is the statement, ‚ÄúDeath occurs even when merit is exhausted, but not when life is exhausted.

original: bsod nams zad pa las kyang 'chi ba @235a * //
analyzed: bsod nams zad pa las kyang 'chi ba @235a * //
translated: ‚Äù Death occurs when merit is exhausted,

original: bden te / de med pas tshe gnas pa'i rgyu nye bar mkho ba med pas de ltar tshe'i gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden te / de med pas tshe gnas pa'i rgyu nye bar mkho ba med pas de ltar tshe'i gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not when life is exhausted, because the cause of life is exhausted.

original: bsod nams zad pa kho na las 'chi ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams zad pa kho na las 'chi ba ma yin te /
translated: Death does not occur when merit is exhausted alone,

original: ji ltar tshe zad pa kho na las ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tshe zad pa kho na las ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it does not occur when life is exhausted alone.

original: tshe zad pa la bsod nams zad pa las 'chi ba la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe zad pa la bsod nams zad pa las 'chi ba la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When life is exhausted, merit has no power to cause death.

original: yang bstan bcos gzhan gyi sgo nas dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir ye shes la 'jug pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: yang bstan bcos gzhan gyi sgo nas dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir ye shes la 'jug pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that untimely death exists, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe Bodhisattva Stages and the Compendium statement,‚Äù and so on.

original: bshad pa 'dis ji lta bus ma yin par 'chi ba bstan ces mi shes pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa 'dis ji lta bus ma yin par 'chi ba bstan ces mi shes pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: Since it is not understood how this explanation demonstrates that untimely death exists, the root text asks, ‚ÄúHow does this explanation demonstrate that untimely death exists?‚Äù

original: bshad pa 'di'i don gang yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di'i don gang yin zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the meaning of this explanation?

original: gang la lus la gnod pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang la lus la gnod pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement, ‚Äúbecause they can harm the body,‚Äù

original: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi lus la ni gnod par bya bar nus te /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi lus la ni gnod par bya bar nus te /
translated: the bodies of those who are not absorbed in the meditative attainment of cessation or the meditative attainment of nonperception can be harmed.

original: de'i phyir de dag tshe la ni lus la gnod pa byas pas gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tshe la ni lus la gnod pa byas pas gnod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, their life force is harmed by the harm done to the body,

original: lus kyi rgyud la ma bltos pa'i tshe 'jug pa med pas lus kyi rgyud la rag las pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdang po yin no zhes bya ba la 'dod pa na spyod pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyud la ma bltos pa'i tshe 'jug pa med pas lus kyi rgyud la rag las pa'i phyir ro // dang po yin no zhes bya ba la 'dod pa na spyod pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: because the life force is dependent on the body continuum, since it does not occur without regard to the body continuum.üîΩThe first is the explanation that begins with the words, ‚ÄúThose that pertain to the desire realm,‚Äù

original: rgyud la rag las te 'jug pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: rgyud la rag las te 'jug pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: and concludes with the words, ‚Äúit should be said that they are dependent on the body continuum.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang ; 'dod pa'i khams su 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la ni rten la ni gnod par byas pas tshe la gnod pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang ; 'dod pa'i khams su 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la ni rten la ni gnod par byas pas tshe la gnod pa med de /
translated: The meditative attainments of the formless realm and the meditative attainment of cessation in the desire realm are not harmed by life because they are not harmed by the basis.

original: rang dang gzhan gyis gnod pa'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyis gnod pa'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They transcend the realm of harm by self and others.

original: de'i phyir de ni ji ltar skyes bzhin gnas pas bar skabs su rgyun rnam par chad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni ji ltar skyes bzhin gnas pas bar skabs su rgyun rnam par chad pa med do //

original: gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second, beginning with ‚Äúthose who have entered meditative attainment‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúshould be stated.‚Äù

original: glo bur dang bcas pa ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: glo bur dang bcas pa ni dang po yin no //
translated: The first is with adventitious.

original: de glo bur dang bcas pa ni lus la gnod pa byas pa'i sgo nas te gegs dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: de glo bur dang bcas pa ni lus la gnod pa byas pa'i sgo nas te gegs dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The first is with adventitious, because it is harmed by harming the body, meaning it is obstructed.

original: glo bur med pa ni gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: glo bur med pa ni gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is without adventitious.

original: de'i rten la gnod pa med pa'i phyir 'di ni glo bur med cing gegs med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten la gnod pa med pa'i phyir 'di ni glo bur med cing gegs med pa yin no //
translated: Because the life faculty is not harmed in these states, they are not untimely deaths, nor are they interrupted.

original: de lta bas na dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni yod do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshe rgyud la rag las pa dang / glo bur dang bcas pa @235b bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni yod do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshe rgyud la rag las pa dang / glo bur dang bcas pa @235b bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, untimely death exists because life is dependent on the continuum of aggregates and because it is said to be subject to external conditions.

original: mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The sutra states...

original: chos mngon pa las bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: This is not only explained in the Abhidharma.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does the sutra say?

original: mdo las kyang dus ma yin par 'chi ba gsungs so //üîΩbdag rgyur gyur pa'i 'chi ba ni bdag nyid 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las kyang dus ma yin par 'chi ba gsungs so // bdag rgyur gyur pa'i 'chi ba ni bdag nyid 'chi ba'o //
translated: The sutra states that there is untimely death.üîΩDeath that is the cause of self is death by one‚Äôs own hand.

original: gzhan rgyur gyur pa'i 'chi ba ni gzhan gyis gsod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rgyur gyur pa'i 'chi ba ni gzhan gyis gsod pa'o //
translated: Death that is the cause of another is being killed by another.

original: mu bzhir zhes bya ba 'byung ste gang du bdag nyid 'chi la gzhan dag gis gsod pa ma yin pa dang / gang du gzhan dag gis gsod la bdag nyid 'chi ba ma yin pa dang / gang du gnyis ka yin pa dang / gang du gnyis ka ma yin pa bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: mu bzhir zhes bya ba 'byung ste gang du bdag nyid 'chi la gzhan dag gis gsod pa ma yin pa dang / gang du gzhan dag gis gsod la bdag nyid 'chi ba ma yin pa dang / gang du gnyis ka yin pa dang / gang du gnyis ka ma yin pa bgrang ba'o //
translated: The four possibilities are enumerated: where one dies by oneself and is not killed by another, where one is killed by another and does not die by oneself, where both are true, and where both are false.

original: rab tu dga' ba dang yid rab tu 'khrugs pa dag gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang yid rab tu 'khrugs pa dag gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: By means of great joy and great mental disturbance.

original: lha rtsed mos myos pa rnams ni rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: lha rtsed mos myos pa rnams ni rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: The gods who are intoxicated with play are greatly joyful.

original: de dag ni shin tu rtse ba dang / dga' ba la sogs pas lus dub ba dang / dran pa myos pa dag gis gnas de nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu rtse ba dang / dga' ba la sogs pas lus dub ba dang / dran pa myos pa dag gis gnas de nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //

original: yid rab tu 'khrugs pa rnams ni yid rab tu 'khrugs pa ste /
analyzed: yid rab tu 'khrugs pa rnams ni yid rab tu 'khrugs pa ste /

original: de dag ni phan tshun mig gis mig la bltos pas yid 'khrugs par 'gyur zhing des na gnas dan 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun mig gis mig la bltos pas yid 'khrugs par 'gyur zhing des na gnas dan 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They die from that place by mental disturbance through mutual glances.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid 'grongs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid 'grongs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand also of the Buddhas‚Äù means that they die by themselves.

original: gzhan gyis 'grongs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'grongs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They do not die by the action of another.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause of this is stated:

original: bdag nyid 'grongs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'grongs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jug pa ni nus pa nyams pa'i tshe bdag nyid ma gtogs la 'das pa'i dus su sbo ba'o //
translated: The activity of impermanence causes the eight phenomena that are its effect to be transferred to the past when they are induced by aging, excluding itself.

original: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la zhes bya ba la skye ba'i skye ba kho na la 'jug gi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la zhes bya ba la skye ba'i skye ba kho na la 'jug gi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: The arising of arising is engaged in the arising of arising alone, not in another.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kho na la 'jug pa'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kho na la 'jug pa'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The impermanence of impermanence is engaged in impermanence alone.

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams nus pa tha dad pas chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams nus pa tha dad pas chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: The arising of arising and so on are engaged in eight and one phenomenon because they have different powers.

original: dper na tshor bas phan pa dang gnod pa las byung ba'i khyad par las yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa yul mang ba dang nyung ba nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tshor bas phan pa dang gnod pa las byung ba'i khyad par las yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa yul mang ba dang nyung ba nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the mental consciousness arises from the difference of benefit and harm, and the eye consciousness arises from the difference of many and few objects.

original: yang na 'bras bu tha dad pa las rigs tha dad pa yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu tha dad pa las rigs tha dad pa yang mthong ngo //
translated: Or, a different type is seen from a different result.

original: de lta bas na thug pa med par zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na thug pa med par zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThere is no infinite regress.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dngos po ba ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' 'dral ba'am rnam par 'byed par byed ces pa'o //üîΩji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dngos po ba ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' 'dral ba'am rnam par 'byed par byed ces pa'o // ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
translated: because the characteristics of conditioned factors are not real entities, like space.üîΩHow is it that they are differentiated?

original: ji ltar rnam par 'byed par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'byed par byed ce na /
translated: How are they differentiated?

original: skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed la /
analyzed: skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed la /
translated: Origination causes the generation of eight factors, with the exception of itself.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The origination of origination causes the generation of just that.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.üîΩAre they substantially existent because they are differentiated?

original: ci de dag rnam par phye ba las rdzas su yod dam zhe na smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci de dag rnam par phye ba las rdzas su yod dam zhe na smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na tshig 'di la nus pa ci yod ce na nus pa 'di yod de /üîΩgzhan gyi bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos pos rdzas su yod pa dag tu rnam par phye na /
analyzed: 'o na tshig 'di la nus pa ci yod ce na nus pa 'di yod de / gzhan gyi bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos pos rdzas su yod pa dag tu rnam par phye na /
translated: What then is the meaning of this statement?üîΩThe meaning is that if they were substantially existent because of the relationship of action and agent,

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyi sgo nas de dag rdzas su yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyi sgo nas de dag rdzas su yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: then they would be substantially existent merely by the differentiation of action and agent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mngon sum ma ma rjes dpag gam yid ches pa'i lung las yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ma ma rjes dpag gam yid ches pa'i lung las yin no //
translated: They are known by direct perception, inference, or trustworthy scripture.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes 'chad de /üîΩtshig tsam la dad par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu dris pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes 'chad de / tshig tsam la dad par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu dris pa ni /
translated: That is why the root text says, ‚Äúbecause there is no valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: ci'i @239b phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i @239b phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since one should not have faith in mere words, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

original: tshad ma min pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩji ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma min pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: The root text explains, ‚ÄúBecause there is no valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: de la re zhig gzugs yod pa nyid la ni tshad ma mngon sum yin no //üîΩmig yod pa nyid la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs yod pa nyid la ni tshad ma mngon sum yin no // mig yod pa nyid la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúFor example, the existence of form is known by direct perception.‚ÄùüîΩThe existence of the eye is known by inference.

original: gnyis ka yod pa ni mig dang rnam par shes pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyis ka yod pa ni mig dang rnam par shes pa dag go //
translated: The existence of both is known by direct perception and inference.

original: gzugs dang bzhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs dang bzhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
translated: The existence of form and the eye is known by scripture.

original: de bzhin du mig dang gzugs dag la yang rgya cher ba lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang gzugs dag la yang rgya cher ba lta bar bya'o //
translated: The existence of the eye and form should be understood in the same way.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to sound, etc.

original: yang na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa smos pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa smos pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: Or else, the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúform, etc.‚Äù refer to feeling, etc.

original: de ma tshor ba yod pa nyid la ni de'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba de yongs su gcod par byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma tshor ba yod pa nyid la ni de'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba de yongs su gcod par byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum tshad ma yin no //
translated: When there is the existence of a feeling that has not been felt, the mental consciousness that arises immediately after it and determines it is direct perception.

original: lus la rnam par dpyad pas gzhan gyi rgyud la bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar rig pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: lus la rnam par dpyad pas gzhan gyi rgyud la bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar rig pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The inference is the knowledge of the experience of pleasure and pain in another‚Äôs continuum through the analysis of the body.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
translated: The scriptural statement is ‚ÄúThe visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.‚Äù

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The innate feeling is the feeling that arises simultaneously with the consciousness.

original: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar gnas zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar gnas zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: The same applies to the statement ‚ÄúHaving seen forms with the eye, one remains with a happy mind.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'du shes la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: So too, it should be applied to discernment and so on.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni mig la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni mig la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Origination and so on are not apprehended by the eye and so forth.

original: de dag yod pa nyid la nus pa dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin zhing rdzas su yod pa nyid la lung yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid la nus pa dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin zhing rdzas su yod pa nyid la lung yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there an inference that is capable of ascertaining their existence, nor is there a scriptural statement that they substantially exist.

original: ci gang las btags par yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba de dag btags pa nyid du khas len pa'i tshad ma yod dam zhe na yod de /
analyzed: ci gang las btags par yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba de dag btags pa nyid du khas len pa'i tshad ma yod dam zhe na yod de /
translated: But is there a valid cognition that accepts that they are imputed existents, from which they would be imputed existents?

original: chos gang dag rdzas su yod pa nyid la tshad ma dmigs shing yod do zhes bya bar kun tu tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag ni btags par yod pa yin te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar nges so //üîΩ'o na gang mdo las zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: chos gang dag rdzas su yod pa nyid la tshad ma dmigs shing yod do zhes bya bar kun tu tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag ni btags par yod pa yin te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar nges so //üîΩ'o na gang mdo las zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It is certain that any phenomenon that is ascertained by valid cognition to substantially exist and is designated as existent is an imputed existent, like a vase and so on.üîΩBut if they are imputed existents, how could they be the objects of the four investigations and the four thorough knowledges?

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rgyun yod do zhes lung gis ston par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rgyun yod do zhes lung gis ston par byed do zhe na /
translated: and that the continuum of birth, etc. also exists.

original: lung 'di yod mod kyi 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod do zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lung 'di yod mod kyi 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod do zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: This scripture exists, but it does not mean that the arising, etc. of conditioned factors exist as real substances.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshig shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdon las rton par gsungs so zhes bya @240a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshig shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // don las rton par gsungs so zhes bya @240a * //
translated: That is why it says, ‚ÄúThe wise delight in the meaning, not in the letter,‚Äù etc.

original: ba ni don la rton par bya'i tshig la ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba ni don la rton par bya'i tshig la ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that one should rely on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: 'di'i don gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: gang 'di mdo las 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di mdo las 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the meaning of the sutra passage, ‚ÄúThe arising of conditioned factors is evident,‚Äù etc.

original: ma rig pas mdongs pa'i byis pa rnams zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pas mdongs pa'i byis pa rnams zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe childish, obscured by ignorance,‚Äù etc.

original: 'du byed rnams dang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyun skye ba gcig gam gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag ma rig pas blo'i mig nyams pa'i phyir rgyun yin no snyam du mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyun skye ba gcig gam gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag ma rig pas blo'i mig nyams pa'i phyir rgyun yin no snyam du mi rtogs so //
translated: The continuum of formations, of form, feeling, etc., is not understood as a continuum because the eye of intelligence is impaired by ignorance.

original: de'i phyir de la rtag pa dang gcig nyid du 'dzin pa mngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gir mos pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rtag pa dang gcig nyid du 'dzin pa mngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gir mos pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the belief in a self and in things pertaining to a self is the adherence to the belief in a self and in things pertaining to a self, which is the cause of the adherence to the belief in an extreme.

original: de las de la sred pa skye zhing de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pas mngon par zhen te chags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: de las de la sred pa skye zhing de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pas mngon par zhen te chags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: From that, craving arises, and one is attached to the belief in a self and in things pertaining to a self, because one desires not to be separated from it. This is the meaning.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir mos pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir mos pa ste /
translated: The belief in a self and in things pertaining to a self is called ‚Äúthat‚Äù in the verse.

original: bzlog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to reverse that, i.e., in order to abandon that.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid 'chad pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is being explained.

original: 'dus byas nyid bstan pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid bstan pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The belief in a self and in things pertaining to a self is reversed by the teaching of conditioned origination.

original: 'dus byas nyid de yang skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa med par shes par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid de yang skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa med par shes par mi nus pa'o //
translated: and that conditioned itself cannot be known without the teaching of arising, etc.

original: de'i phyir / gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said in detail, ‚ÄúThese three‚Äù and so on.

original: yang ji ltar mtshan nyid 'di dag rgyun kho na la bshad kyi /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mtshan nyid 'di dag rgyun kho na la bshad kyi /
translated: Moreover, how are these characteristics explained only in relation to a continuum,

original: skad cig lam yin par shes she na /
analyzed: skad cig lam yin par shes she na /
translated: and not in relation to a moment?

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: skad cig ma la ni skye ba'i skye pa la sogs pa mi mngon no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma la ni skye ba'i skye pa la sogs pa mi mngon no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúArising, etc. are not evident in a moment.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because momentariness is not ascertained.

original: bsdus par yang min te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdus par yang min te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it in a collection, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: skad cig ma la mi mngon pa dag ni de'i mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma la mi mngon pa dag ni de'i mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are those that are not evident in a moment suitable as its characteristics.

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If something is a characteristic because it characterizes,

original: rang nyid ma shes pa ni gzhan mtshon par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid ma shes pa ni gzhan mtshon par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: then something that is itself unknown does not characterize another.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the sutra, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rgyun la sogs pa dag mngon gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyun la sogs pa dag mngon gyi /
translated: Because the continuum and so on are manifest,

original: skad cig ma la ma yin pa de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: skad cig ma la ma yin pa de'i phyir mdo las /
translated: but the moment is not, therefore the sutra states:

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The arising of conditioned states is manifest.üîΩIf the moment were manifest in the sutra, then it would state:

original: gal te mdor skad cig la mngon par bzhed par gyur na ni de'i phyir skye ba yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te mdor skad cig la mngon par bzhed par gyur na ni de'i phyir skye ba yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin /
translated: Arising is a characteristic of conditioned states,

original: 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin zhes de skad gsung par 'gyur na gsungs pa yang ma @240b yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin zhes de skad gsung par 'gyur na gsungs pa yang ma @240b yin te /
translated: cessation and enduring and aging are also characteristics of conditioned states.

original: skad cig la mi mngon pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang 'dus byas zhes smos pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skad cig la mi mngon pa'i phyir ro // yang 'dus byas zhes smos pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: But it does not state that because the moment is not manifest.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes 'dus byas smos pa gnyis pa ni 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes 'dus byas smos pa gnyis pa ni 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: The second mention of conditioned states is in the phrase, ‚ÄúThe characteristics of conditioned states are these,‚Äù which indicates that these are the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristics of conditioned factors are the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: de lta ma yin na gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it were otherwise, the Fortunate One would not have specified: ‚ÄúThese three are the characteristics of conditioned factors.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni chu dang chu skyar lta bu 'dus byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no snyam du dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chu dang chu skyar lta bu 'dus byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no snyam du dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would think that these three are the characteristics of the existence of conditioned factors, as the water-bird is the characteristic of the existence of water.

original: 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas dpe yin no //
translated: This example is not appropriate.

original: ji ltar chu skyar chu yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /üîΩchu nyid kyi sa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag kyang 'dus byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar chu skyar chu yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi / chu nyid kyi sa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag kyang 'dus byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The water-bird is the characteristic of the existence of water, but not of water itself.

original: 'dus byas nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, these three are the characteristics of the existence of conditioned factors, but not of conditioned factors themselves.

original: yang na bu mo'i mtshan nyid ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na bu mo'i mtshan nyid ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Or else, the characteristics of a maiden are her virtue and her vice;

original: bu mo nyid kyis ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bu mo nyid kyis ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the girl herself is the characteristics of the girl.üîΩ

original: 'dus byas nyid kyis ni ma yin no snyam du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid kyis ni ma yin no snyam du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the characteristics of a woman are not the characteristics of a man, in the same way, the characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue are not the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba smos pa gnyis pas ni 'di dag 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /

original: de'i phyir rgyun lo na'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du skye'o zhes rgyas par gsungs kyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun lo na'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du skye'o zhes rgyas par gsungs kyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lord, considering the continuum, said in detail: ‚ÄúSon of good family, Nanda‚Äôs feeling arises while being known,‚Äù but not in terms of the moment.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i don nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i don nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Two verses to show the meaning just explained.

original: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The first of the continuum is birth.

original: gnyis ga yang rgyun dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyis ga yang rgyun dang sbyar ro //
translated: Both are connected with the continuum.

original: gang zhig chad ba zhes bya ba 'dir yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig chad ba zhes bya ba 'dir yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And in the phrase ‚Äúthat which is severed,‚Äù it is as before.

original: gnas pa de zhes bya ba rgyun nyid gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa de zhes bya ba rgyun nyid gnas pa ste /
translated: That which abides is the continuum itself, abiding.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni med ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir yang gnyis ka la rgyun ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni med ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir yang gnyis ka la rgyun ces sbyar ro //
translated: And in the phrase ‚Äúnot otherwise,‚Äù etc., both are connected with the continuum.

original: skad cig ma'i chos la ni zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i chos la ni zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúin a momentary dharma,‚Äù etc.,

original: skad cig ma'i chos ni gnas pa med dang 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i chos ni gnas pa med dang 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: a momentary dharma does not abide, because it perishes.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i gnas pa khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i gnas pa khas len pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, we accept that the endurance of that is the stream itself.

original: chos de yang gnas pa med du zin yang 'jig par 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: chos de yang gnas pa med du zin yang 'jig par 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: And that dharma, even though it does not endure, is still destroyed.

original: skad @242b cig ma yin pa kho nas gnas pa don med do //
analyzed: skad @242b cig ma yin pa kho nas gnas pa don med do //
translated: Since it is momentary, endurance is meaningless.

original: yongs su rtogs pa de'i phyir rgyun kho na gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa de'i phyir rgyun kho na gnas pa yin te /
translated: Because of that understanding, endurance is the stream itself.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma'i chos gnas par yongs su rtogs na don med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma'i chos gnas par yongs su rtogs na don med do //
translated: If one understands that a momentary dharma endures, it is meaningless.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, means

original: gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin pa des na'o //
translated: because endurance is the stream itself.üîΩIf that is explained, then the Abhidharma is established.

original: de ltar bshad na chos mngon pa la gnas pa gang zhen zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na chos mngon pa la gnas pa gang zhen zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: In the statement, ‚ÄúWhat is endurance?,‚Äù

original: skyes bas skad cig ma la ni 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: skyes bas skad cig ma la ni 'jig pa med de /
translated: destruction does not exist for a momentary dharma,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be momentary.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed skyes pa rnams la mi 'jig pas rgyun chags par 'brel ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi skad cig ma ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //üîΩgang yang ye shes la 'jug pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩder ni gcig la zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed skyes pa rnams la mi 'jig pas rgyun chags par 'brel ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi skad cig ma ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so // gang yang ye shes la 'jug pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / der ni gcig la zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The following is stated in the context of the objection that the sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary:üîΩ‚ÄúThe sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because it declares that they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen.

original: sems kyi skad cig kho na bzhed do snyam du sems pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod de /üîΩder yang ris mthun pa'i sems la rigs kyi sems kyi skad cig ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o //üîΩris mthun pa'i sems ni dang por nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig kho na bzhed do snyam du sems pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod de / der yang ris mthun pa'i sems la rigs kyi sems kyi skad cig ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o // ris mthun pa'i sems ni dang por nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas /
translated: The following is stated in order to dispel the idea that the sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen:üîΩ‚ÄúThe sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because it declares that they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen.‚ÄùüîΩThe sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because it declares that they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen.

original: 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa skye ba gcig gi bdag nyid can yin no //üîΩ'di gang las she na /üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa skye ba gcig gi bdag nyid can yin no // 'di gang las she na / gang gi phyir /
translated: The sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because it declares that they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen.üîΩThe sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because it declares that they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen.

original: 'jig pa gang zhe na rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes lan brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig pa gang zhe na rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes lan brjod par bya ba la /
translated: The sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because it declares that they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen.üîΩThe sutra declares that conditioned states are momentary because it declares that they are momentary in the sense of not remaining for a second moment after their first moment of having arisen.

original: 'chi ba'o zhes bya ba smras pa des na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'o zhes bya ba smras pa des na /
translated: The word death is used because it is the cessation of a homogeneous continuum of aggregates.

original: ris mthun pa'i sems la dgongs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //üîΩgang gi phyir skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i sems la dgongs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so // gang gi phyir skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the word death is used with reference to a continuum of minds of the same type.üîΩBecause it is momentary, it is not established that it endures for one moment and it changes in the next moment is aging.

original: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa dang / de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rga ba yin par ma grub pa des na rga ba ni rnam pa gzhan nyid do zhes pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa dang / de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rga ba yin par ma grub pa des na rga ba ni rnam pa gzhan nyid do zhes pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Therefore, with reference to the statement, Aging is a different state,

original: 'jig pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba kho na gzhan no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba kho na gzhan no //
translated: it is said that change in the aspect of destruction is another.

original: gnas pa dang skye ba las gzhan du rga ba ni rnam par 'jig par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang skye ba las gzhan du rga ba ni rnam par 'jig par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Aging is a different state from endurance and arising, and it is also destruction.

original: sngon gyi gnas skabs las rnam par 'gyur ba med pa ni gzhan ma yin pas zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas skabs las rnam par 'gyur ba med pa ni gzhan ma yin pas zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is not another state means that it is not a different state from its previous state.

original: der ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba rga ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: der ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba rga ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In that case, it is said that aging is a different state from endurance.

original: de'i phyir de'i rigs mthun pa'i sems la rung gi sems kyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rigs mthun pa'i sems la rung gi sems kyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to say that death is with reference to a continuum of minds of the same type, but it is not appropriate to say that it is with reference to a moment of mind.

original: rgyun yang sems la snang ba'i phyir dang sems kyang gcig nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skad cig ma bzhin rgyun yang mi 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun yang sems la snang ba'i phyir dang sems kyang gcig nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skad cig ma bzhin rgyun yang mi 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: And since the continuum also appears to the mind and the mind is one, is not the continuum like the moment, that is, it does not exist?

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩ'jig @243a * //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te / 'jig @243a * //
translated: This is not so.

original: rten na snang ba'i bdag nyid kyang rgyun yul gyi rang bzhin rnam par shes pa las phyi rol lta bur ston te /
analyzed: rten na snang ba'i bdag nyid kyang rgyun yul gyi rang bzhin rnam par shes pa las phyi rol lta bur ston te /
translated: The continuum is not like the moment, because the continuum is perceived in the world as having the nature of a series, and because it is not taught to be momentary.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo sa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo sa ma yin no //
translated: The continuum is not the nature of consciousness, because it is taught to be the nature of the object.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis rnam par shes pa la skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis rnam par shes pa la skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the consciousness of one who has an eye disease perceives hairs, flies, etc.

original: des na bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa med pa rnams la ni mi ldan te /
analyzed: des na bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa med pa rnams la ni mi ldan te /
translated: Therefore, those who are free from the attachment of grasping the self and what belongs to the self are not bound by the appropriated aggregates, because the grasping of those two has been eliminated.

original: der 'dzin pa ldog ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams gsungs so //
analyzed: der 'dzin pa ldog ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught the characteristics of the conditioned in order to eliminate the grasping of those two.

original: de sngar nyid du bshad pa de'i phyir de'i rgyun ci skad bshad pa'i rnam pas skye ba la sogs par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de sngar nyid du bshad pa de'i phyir de'i rgyun ci skad bshad pa'i rnam pas skye ba la sogs par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Because it was previously explained that the continuum of the aggregates is the self, the continuum of the aggregates should be understood to be born, etc., in the manner previously explained.

original: rab rib can la skra la sogs pa dang ; nam langs pa na 'khyog cing 'khyil ba la sprul la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rab rib can la skra la sogs pa dang ; nam langs pa na 'khyog cing 'khyil ba la sprul la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: It is like the appearance of hair, etc., to one with an eye disease and the appearance of a coiled rope as a snake at dusk.

original: 'dir mi rigs pa ci zhe na gang du sems can rnams nyon mongs skye ba dang sgro 'dogs pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir mi rigs pa ci zhe na gang du sems can rnams nyon mongs skye ba dang sgro 'dogs pa las yin gyi /
translated: What is unreasonable here? The afflictions arise in sentient beings from reification,

original: don dam pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: not from the ultimate.

original: de sun 'byin pa'i ched kho nar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos ston par mdzad de ;
analyzed: de sun 'byin pa'i ched kho nar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos ston par mdzad de ;
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddhas teach the Dharma solely for the purpose of refuting that.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / bsags pa kun gyi mtha' 'dzad cing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsags pa kun gyi mtha' 'dzad cing //
translated: The end of accumulation is depletion.

original: bslang ba'i mtha' ni 'gyel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bslang ba'i mtha' ni 'gyel bar 'gyur //
translated: The end of rising is falling.

original: phrad pa'i mtha' ni 'bral ba ste //
analyzed: phrad pa'i mtha' ni 'bral ba ste //
translated: The end of meeting is separation.

original: gson pa'i mtha' ni 'chi ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gson pa'i mtha' ni 'chi ba yin // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The end of life is death.

original: skad cig ma re re la yang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la yang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: And also, ‚ÄúMoment by moment, etc.‚Äù

original: skye ba ni sngar med pa las byung zhing bdag nyid du thob pa dang ; rdzas gzhan yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te /üîΩdngos po ma skyes pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni sngar med pa las byung zhing bdag nyid du thob pa dang ; rdzas gzhan yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te / dngos po ma skyes pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is arising suitable as a different substance, since it would follow that the thing would not have arisen.

original: de'i skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba nyid du brtag go zhe na /
analyzed: de'i skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba nyid du brtag go zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is considered arising because it is the cause of arising,

original: rkyen thams cad skye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen thams cad skye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that all conditions are arising,

original: de'i skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in their being the cause of arising.

original: de'i phyir / skad cig ma re re la ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skad cig ma re re la ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, arising is the occurrence of what did not previously exist in each moment,

original: rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a different substance.

original: bdag nyid rnyed pa'i bdag nyid log pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid rnyed pa'i bdag nyid log pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi /
translated: Cessation is the reversal of the nature of that which has been obtained,

original: don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
translated: but it is not a different object,

original: de ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not cease.

original: de'i phyir byung nas med pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byung nas med pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
translated: Therefore, cessation is the nonexistence of what has arisen, but it is not a different substance.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su 'brel pa ni gnas pa yin gyi skyes pa mi 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su 'brel pa ni gnas pa yin gyi skyes pa mi 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The connection of cause and effect is endurance, not the non-cessation of what has arisen.

original: de'i rgyu skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that its cause would not be momentary.

original: 'di ltar smra ba bdag da rung du yang mar med de nyid 'jug go zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba bdag da rung du yang mar med de nyid 'jug go zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the self is not momentary, but endures.

original: de'i phyir / snga ma snga ma dang skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma rjes su 'brel ba ni gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir / snga ma snga ma dang skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma rjes su 'brel ba ni gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the connection of the prior and subsequent moments is endurance.

original: don @243b gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: don @243b gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no transformation of the object.

original: rgyu'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu'i skad cig ma bye brag tu gyur pa ni gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi skad cig ma'i gnas skabs tha dad pa gzhan nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu'i skad cig ma bye brag tu gyur pa ni gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi skad cig ma'i gnas skabs tha dad pa gzhan nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The transformation of endurance is the transformation of the effect from the cause, because it follows that the state of the moment would be different.

original: gnas pa de skad cig ma snga ma dang mi 'dra bas gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa de skad cig ma snga ma dang mi 'dra bas gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That endurance is different from the prior moment, but it is not a transformation of the object.

original: de ltar yang 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag tu mos pa rnams kyi bdag tu mos pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag tu mos pa rnams kyi bdag tu mos pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to reverse the belief in a self of those who believe in a self of the continuum of formations,

original: rgyun dang skad cig ma du ma'i dbye ba tha dad pas tha dad pa rnams la bzlog par bya ba ma yin par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rgyun dang skad cig ma du ma'i dbye ba tha dad pas tha dad pa rnams la bzlog par bya ba ma yin par bzhed nas /
translated: he accepts that it is not to be reversed in those that are different due to the division of many continua and moments.

original: lus skyo ba yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'di brtsams pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skyes so //
analyzed: lus skyo ba yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'di brtsams pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skyes so //
translated: Thus, although he composed this treatise with the meaning of ‚Äúthe body is also seen to be weary,‚Äù and so on, when it is born in a similar way,

original: de'i tshe mi 'dra ba nyid med pas gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi 'dra ba nyid med pas gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: at that time, since there is no difference, there is no transformation of the state.

original: de dag 'dra bar yang dmigs mod kyi rnam pa thams cad du khyad par med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag 'dra bar yang dmigs mod kyi rnam pa thams cad du khyad par med pa ma yin no //
translated: Although they are observed to be similar, they are not without difference in every way.

original: 'dra bar dmigs kyang rnam pa thams cad du khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bar dmigs kyang rnam pa thams cad du khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: Although observed to be similar, they are without difference in every way.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar shes she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: de'i phyir / rdo rje la sogs pa 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang stobs chung dus 'phangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rdo rje la sogs pa 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang stobs chung dus 'phangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúwhether it is thrown or not thrown, whether it is thrown with great force or with little force, etc.‚Äù

original: 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhether it is thrown or not thrown‚Äù refers to that which is thrown and that which is not thrown.

original: stobs chen pos 'phangs pa dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ni stobs chen po dang / stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dag ste /
analyzed: stobs chen pos 'phangs pa dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ni stobs chen po dang / stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhether it is thrown with great force or with little force‚Äù refers to that which is thrown with great force and that which is thrown with little force.

original: 'di ni 'phangs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa gnyis yin no //üîΩ'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dag dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dag ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phangs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa gnyis yin no // 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dag dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dag ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o //
translated: This is the twofold classification of that which is thrown.üîΩThat which is thrown and that which is not thrown, that which is thrown with great force and that which is thrown with little force, are that which is thrown and that which is not thrown, and that which is thrown with great force and that which is thrown with little force.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa de ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa de ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ste /
translated: That which is thrown and that which is not thrown, and that which is thrown with great force and that which is thrown with little force, are a diamond, etc.

original: dngos po gcig dang 'dra bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig dang 'dra bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar to a single entity.

analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang rang gi yul dang nye ba dang ring ba las bye brag shes par bya'o //

translated: Since it is not possible to distinguish slow, fast, and very fast times for vajras and so on that do not undergo the aforementioned transformation, it is not contradictory that all formations are subject to change, just as they are subject to birth.

analyzed: gal te rdo rje la sogs pa dag la yang snga ma las skad cig ma phyi ma mi 'dra bar skye na /

analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i dus dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus na /

analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyi @245a * //
