translated: The acquisition of an existence that is dependent on causes and conditions is the conditioned.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dang gzhan du gyur pa nyid dag ni mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dang gzhan du gyur pa nyid dag ni mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Prior non-existence, posterior non-existence, and alteration are the characteristics.

original: 'dir de nyid kho na de'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir de nyid kho na de'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Here, that itself is not the characteristic of that.

original: 'o na ci ltar gal te snga nas med pa'i mtshan nyid skye bar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gal te snga nas med pa'i mtshan nyid skye bar brjod ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it that prior non-existence is said to be the characteristic of arising?‚Äù

original: skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that arising is also evident.

original: snga nas med pa skye bar 'os pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: snga nas med pa skye bar 'os pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Since prior non-existence is not suitable for arising,

original: 'dir skye ba smos pa ni snga nas med pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba smos pa ni snga nas med pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
translated: The mention of arising here is for the purpose of indicating that which did not exist previously.

original: skye ba ni bdag nyid du red pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni bdag nyid du red pa'o //
translated: Arising is the coming into existence of something that did not exist.

original: de yang snga nas med pa las ltos pa med de /üîΩl'a bho hya la bha sva bha ba ti la bha sye ti /
analyzed: de yang snga nas med pa las ltos pa med de / l'a bho hya la bha sva bha ba ti la bha sye ti /
translated: And that does not depend on that which did not exist previously.üîΩBecause the arising of something that did not exist previously is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir ma thob pa las thob pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma thob pa las thob pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the attainment of non-attainment is called attainment.

original: yang na skye ba nyid ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang na skye ba nyid ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: Or else, arising itself is the characteristic.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i chos te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i chos te /
translated: That is the general property of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni so sor mtshon pas 'dus byas nyid do //üîΩ'dus (thob pa ma thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni so sor mtshon pas 'dus byas nyid do // 'dus (thob pa ma thob pa yin no //
translated: Form, etc. are conditioned by their individual characteristics.

original: thob pa'i zhes bya ba) byas nyid kyang rkyen rnams 'dus te byung ba las byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i zhes bya ba) byas nyid kyang rkyen rnams 'dus te byung ba las byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Conditionedness is also the form, etc. that are produced from the assemblage of conditions.

original: yod pa smos pas de'i skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can gzung gi 'dus byas kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa smos pas de'i skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can gzung gi 'dus byas kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mention of existence indicates that which is preceded by its arising, but not the existence of the conditioned.

original: mtshan nyid 'di rnams rang bzhin las yin zhing gzung ba rnams la yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la ni re zhig ma yin no ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di rnams rang bzhin las yin zhing gzung ba rnams la yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la ni re zhig ma yin no ;
translated: These characteristics are not from the intrinsic reality of those things that are apprehended, such as form, etc.

original: / de dag gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: / de dag gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin ba'i phyir la /
translated: because they are not the intrinsic reality of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na yang de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na yang de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if they are not the intrinsic reality of form, etc., it follows that they are substantially existent.

original: de dag las skye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag las skye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúarising, etc., from those,‚Äù etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan rdzas nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan rdzas nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: they are not substantially existent apart from form, etc.

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams btags par yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams btags par yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because arising, etc., are nominally existent.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
analyzed: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
translated: The first of a continuum is arising.

original: zhes rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: zhes rgyas par bshad do //
translated: This is explained at length.üîΩWhat would be the consequence?

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lung ngam rigs pa dang 'gal snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lung ngam rigs pa dang 'gal snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: He thinks that this contradicts scripture or reasoning.

original: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir @246a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir @246a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are co-existent.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag chos dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag chos dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because you accept that arising, etc. are coexistent with the thing itself, it follows that the thing would have activity.

original: de'i phyir chos gcig tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gcig tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, with respect to the statement, ‚Äúone thing,‚Äù

original: chos dang por skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos dang por skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: it is not the case that the thing arises first,

original: de nas gnas pa dang / de nas rga ba dang / de nas 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nas gnas pa dang / de nas rga ba dang / de nas 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then endures, then ages, and then is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na dus gcig tu skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na dus gcig tu skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, arising, enduring, and being destroyed would occur at one time.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that is not so,

original: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then because the time of activity is different.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dus gcig tu skye ba la sogs par 'gyur mod kyi ;
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dus gcig tu skye ba la sogs par 'gyur mod kyi ;
translated: Arising, etc. would occur at one time because they are coexistent causes.

original: 'on kyang de dag gi bya ba'i dus tha dad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi bya ba'i dus tha dad de /
translated: However, the time of their activity is different.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa'i chos ma 'ongs pa la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa'i chos ma 'ongs pa la bya ba byed do //
translated: Arising causes the activity of the future thing in the future.

original: 'di ltar ma skyes pa bskyed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes pa bskyed do //
translated: In this way, it generates that which has not yet arisen.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid la rgyu smras pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid la rgyu smras pa'o //
translated: This is the cause of that which is to be generated.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the action of arising is that which generates.

original: skyes zin pa la yang skyed par ni mi nus te ;
analyzed: skyes zin pa la yang skyed par ni mi nus te ;
translated: It is not possible to generate that which has already arisen.

original: de'i phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa kho nas chos ma 'ongs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa kho nas chos ma 'ongs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to say that the future state of arising generates the future state of the entity.

original: da ltar gyi gnas skabs su ni bya ba gzhan zhig par 'gyur ro //üîΩbskyed zin pa'i chos la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gnas skabs su ni bya ba gzhan zhig par 'gyur ro // bskyed zin pa'i chos la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: But in the present state, another action would occur.üîΩThe action of enduring and so on

original: chos skyes pa ni gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / gzhig par nus kyi ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos skyes pa ni gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / gzhig par nus kyi ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The action of enduring and so on is that which causes the entity that has arisen to endure, to be destroyed, and to age.üîΩThe action of enduring and so on is that which causes the entity that has arisen to endure, to be destroyed, and to age.

original: de'i phyir / skyes zin pa'i chos la gnas pa la sogs pa da ltar ba bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / skyes zin pa'i chos la gnas pa la sogs pa da ltar ba bya ba byed do //
translated: Therefore, the present action of enduring and so on causes the entity that has already arisen to endure and so on.

original: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe skye ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe skye ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, when the entity has arisen, the action of arising and so on occurs.

original: re zhig 'dir ci zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir ci zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: What is the purpose of this analysis?

original: ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The future does not substantially exist.

original: de med na ji ltar skye ba ma 'ongs pa yod pa yin pas bskyed par bya ba bskyed par 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de med na ji ltar skye ba ma 'ongs pa yod pa yin pas bskyed par bya ba bskyed par 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If it does not exist, how could the future generation exist? Thus, it is thought that that which is to be generated is generated.

original: ma 'ongs pa de rdzas su yod du chug yang skye ba bya ba med na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa de rdzas su yod du chug yang skye ba bya ba med na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Even if future time exists substantially, if the action of generation does not exist, then how could future time be established?

original: bya ba ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: bya ba ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin par 'dod la /
translated: The future is asserted to be that which has not yet obtained activity.

original: bya ba byed bzhin pa ni da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed bzhin pa ni da ltar ba'o //
translated: The present is that in which activity is being performed.

original: bya ba zhig pa 'das pa yin no zhes de ltar dus rnam par gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bya ba zhig pa 'das pa yin no zhes de ltar dus rnam par gnas pa yin /
translated: The past is that in which activity has ceased. Thus, time is established in this way.

original: skye ba bya ba byed na ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba bya ba byed na ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If the action of generation performs its activity, how could it be established as future?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i phyir mi 'grub pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i phyir mi 'grub pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The future is not established because it is the activity of a person.

original: gal te rdzas su yod pa bya ba byed bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa yin na ni @246b ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rdzas su yod pa bya ba byed bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa yin na ni @246b ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: If that which exists substantially and performs its activity is future, then the characteristic of the future should be stated.

original: byung ba yang bya ba zhig pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩbya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: byung ba yang bya ba zhig pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: If the state of having ceased is the action, then the state of having arisen would be past.üîΩIf the state of having ceased is the action, then the state of having arisen would be past.

original: gal te da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su skye ba bya ba zhig pa yin na yang 'das pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su skye ba bya ba zhig pa yin na yang 'das pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the state of having arisen is the action, then the state of having arisen would be past.

original: da ltar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not past.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa yang cig car bya ba la 'jug pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa yang cig car bya ba la 'jug pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If enduring and so on engage in action simultaneously, then all would be simultaneous.

original: skyes zin pa'i chos la da ltar gnas pa la sogs pa rnams bya ba byed par khas blangs pas de dag cig car bya ba la 'jug par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i chos la da ltar gnas pa la sogs pa rnams bya ba byed par khas blangs pas de dag cig car bya ba la 'jug par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since you accept that the action of enduring and so on is to make a presently arisen phenomenon endure and so forth, you would have to accept that they engage in action simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma gcig kho na la chos thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma gcig kho na la chos thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore all phenomena would be simultaneous.

original: 'di gang gi tshe zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di gang gi tshe zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If you ask, when does it endure?

original: gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / 'jig pa'i bya ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / 'jig pa'i bya ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the actions of enduring, aging, and disintegrating are mutually exclusive.

original: chos gnas pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin no //
analyzed: chos gnas pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin no //
translated: It is both the enduring and the destruction of a dharma.

original: zhes bya bar ni rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar ni rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable to posit that it is both enduring and disintegrating.

original: 'di ci dus der zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ci dus der zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir da ltar ba la yang bya ba byed do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir da ltar ba la yang bya ba byed do snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks that since enduring and so on are mutually exclusive, they also perform functions in the present.

original: gang skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to what he says, ‚ÄúIf arising and so on also exist in the present,‚Äù

original: ji ltar skyes pa mi skye ba de bzhin du mi gnas pa mi rga lam rgas pas mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa mi skye ba de bzhin du mi gnas pa mi rga lam rgas pas mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
translated: just as what is already arisen does not arise, what is not enduring does not endure, and what is not destroyed does not disintegrate.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams kyang bya ba rim gyis byed do zhes zer ba de'i ltar na skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams kyang bya ba rim gyis byed do zhes zer ba de'i ltar na skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he says that enduring and so on perform their functions sequentially. But if that were so, it would undermine the position that things are momentary.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad pas chung ba yin na 'dir ni gnas pa dang / rga ba'i dus dag tu mi 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum du gnas pas skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad pas chung ba yin na 'dir ni gnas pa dang / rga ba'i dus dag tu mi 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum du gnas pas skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a moment is the smallest unit of time, then since it endures for three moments, it would be harmed by the fact that it endures for three moments, because it does not disintegrate at the time of arising and at the time of aging.

original: 'on te 'di skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'on te 'di skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: But if you say that it is like this, that is,

original: skad cig ma ni dus ji tsam gyis skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i dus de la brjod kyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma ni dus ji tsam gyis skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i dus de la brjod kyi /
translated: that a moment is the time it takes for arising, enduring, aging, and disintegrating to be completed,

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not that it disintegrates immediately after arising.

original: de lta na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then it is like this, that is,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rim gyis bya ba byed par mi rung ste /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rim gyis bya ba byed par mi rung ste /
translated: it is not suitable for coemergent states to perform their function sequentially,

original: sngon dang phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig @247a * //
analyzed: sngon dang phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig @247a * //
translated: because there is no difference between before and after,

original: byed pa'i rkyen khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i rkyen khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because there is no difference in the cooperative conditions.

original: der yang sngar gnas pas bya ba byed kyi /
analyzed: der yang sngar gnas pas bya ba byed kyi /
translated: And there, because of its prior existence, it performs its function,

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: but not because of aging and impermanence. What is the reason for this?

original: gnas pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu smos pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu smos pa ste /
translated: Because endurance is powerful. This is the reason.

original: de'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gi bya ba la gegs byas nas rang gis bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gi bya ba la gegs byas nas rang gis bya ba byed do //
translated: Because of its power, it prevents the function of aging and impermanence and performs its own function.

original: phyis ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid du gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyis ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid du gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why does it become powerful later?

original: gang las 'di chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms par 'gyur ba gnas pa phyis stobs chung ba'i rgyu ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las 'di chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms par 'gyur ba gnas pa phyis stobs chung ba'i rgyu ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no cause for the weakness of endurance later, from which it would be destroyed by impermanence together with the entity.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu lhan cig tu yod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu lhan cig tu yod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the function of endurance and so on would either occur simultaneously with arising or not at all.

original: gal te stobs dang ldan pa'i bya ba sngar 'dod na mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te stobs dang ldan pa'i bya ba sngar 'dod na mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that the powerful action is the first, then the action of impermanence alone would be so.

original: bya ba byas pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bya ba byas pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúbecause the action has been performed‚Äù is as follows.

original: 'dis phyis ni stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rgyu smras pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis phyis ni stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rgyu smras pa ste /
translated: This states the reason why it is not powerful later.

original: bya ba ma byas pa'i gnas pa ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag pas stobs dang ldan pa'i yin gyi /
analyzed: bya ba ma byas pa'i gnas pa ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag pas stobs dang ldan pa'i yin gyi /
translated: The endurance that has not yet performed its action is powerful with respect to aging and impermanence.

original: bya ba byas pas ni yang bya ba byed par mi nus te skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba byas pas ni yang bya ba byed par mi nus te skye ba bzhin no //
translated: But that which has performed its action cannot perform its action again, like that which has arisen.

original: de'i phyir chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, impermanence would destroy it together with the dharma.

original: skye bas ni mi nus par rigs te zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpe don dang mi mthun par ston par byed do //
analyzed: skye bas ni mi nus par rigs te zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpe don dang mi mthun par ston par byed do //
translated: This passage from ‚Äúbecause it is not logical that it is powerless‚Äù teaches that the example is not similar to the meaning.

original: skye bas ni da ltar ba nyid du khyer te 'ongs nas yang bkur bar mi nus so //
analyzed: skye bas ni da ltar ba nyid du khyer te 'ongs nas yang bkur bar mi nus so //
translated: It is not logical that arising is powerless because arising brings it into the present and then cannot bring it again.

original: de'i phyir 'di bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa la nus pa med par rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa la nus pa med par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that even that which has performed its action is incapable of performing its action.

original: gnas pa bya ba byas zin pa nyid yang bya ba mi bya ba la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa bya ba byas zin pa nyid yang bya ba mi bya ba la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that which has already performed its action of enduring does not have a cause for not performing its action again,

original: gang gi phyir gnas pas ni gnas par bya ba yang gnas par bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas pas ni gnas par bya ba yang gnas par bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which endures is capable of enduring again.

original: yang na 'di la gegs byed pa yang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na 'di la gegs byed pa yang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, what would obstruct it?

original: gal te bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa de la gegs byed pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa de la gegs byed pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If that which has already performed its action were to perform its action again, it would have some obstruction.

original: gegs byed pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gegs byed pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it does not have an obstruction.

original: gegs byed pa yod do //
analyzed: gegs byed pa yod do //
translated: Obstruction does exist.

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa de dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa de dag kho na yin no //
translated: Aging and impermanence are precisely that.

original: 'di ltar stobs chung ba'i gegs byed pa ni stobs che ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs chung ba'i gegs byed pa ni stobs che ba yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is weak is obstructed by that which is strong.

original: gal te gnas pa bas stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon kho nas @247b gnas pa rang gi bya ba mi byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa bas stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon kho nas @247b gnas pa rang gi bya ba mi byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were stronger than endurance, then endurance would not perform its function from the outset,

original: de dag gi gegs byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gegs byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be obstructed by them.

original: gnas pa sngon stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa sngon stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Endurance is stronger at the outset,

original: phyis ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag go //
analyzed: phyis ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag go //
translated: and later aging and impermanence are.

original: 'dis rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag gis gnas pa dang lhan cig byed pa la /
analyzed: 'dis rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag gis gnas pa dang lhan cig byed pa la /
translated: By this, aging and impermanence, which are co-existent causes of endurance,

original: sngar gnas pa shin tu byed pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩrang bzhin dang rgyu khyad par med kyang gnas pa sngon stobs dang ldan la /
analyzed: sngar gnas pa shin tu byed pa med par 'gyur ro // rang bzhin dang rgyu khyad par med kyang gnas pa sngon stobs dang ldan la /
translated: would not exist earlier when endurance is very active.

original: phyis stobs dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba 'di yang dad par bya dka' ba zhig go //
analyzed: phyis stobs dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba 'di yang dad par bya dka' ba zhig go //
translated: Even though there is no difference in their intrinsic nature and cause, it is difficult to believe that endurance is stronger at the outset and later it is not strong.

original: de ltar na rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag kyang sngar stobs dang mi ldan la phyis stobs dang ldan no zhes bya bar sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar na rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag kyang sngar stobs dang mi ldan la phyis stobs dang ldan no zhes bya bar sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Thus it is not possible to establish that aging and impermanence are not strong at the outset and are strong later.

original: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩgnas pa ni mi gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / gnas pa ni mi gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: If the action of enduring is stopped,üîΩthen aging and nonendurance would be illogical.

original: gnas pa'i bya ba zhig na yang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag kyang mi gnas la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bya ba zhig na yang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag kyang mi gnas la /
translated: If the action of enduring is stopped, then aging and impermanence would not endure.

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gang gi yin pa'i chos de yang mi gnas so ;
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gang gi yin pa'i chos de yang mi gnas so ;
translated: And the phenomenon that is the basis of aging and impermanence would not endure.üîΩSince they are enduring because they are taken up by the action of enduring, when that is stopped, they definitely do not endure.

original: / de dag ni gnas pas bya ba yongs su gzung bas gnas pa yin zhing de zhig pas de dag nges par mi gnas pa yin pas ji ltar bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag gis bya ba byed nus par 'dod /
analyzed: / de dag ni gnas pas bya ba yongs su gzung bas gnas pa yin zhing de zhig pas de dag nges par mi gnas pa yin pas ji ltar bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag gis bya ba byed nus par 'dod /
translated: How can you assert that aging and impermanence, which do not endure by themselves, can perform their function?

original: chos mi gnas pa ni 'gag pa nyid yin na de 'gags na ni gang zhig la bya ba byed par nus par 'dod /
analyzed: chos mi gnas pa ni 'gag pa nyid yin na de 'gags na ni gang zhig la bya ba byed par nus par 'dod /
translated: If a phenomenon does not endure, it ceases, and if it ceases, how can you assert that it can perform its function?

original: yang na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag gis ci zhig bya ba cung zad kyang med do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag gis ci zhig bya ba cung zad kyang med do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Or else, what function do aging and impermanence perform?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i phyir gnas pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚Äúbecause it is maintained by endurance.‚Äù

original: gnas pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir chos skyes ba tsam de ma zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir chos skyes ba tsam de ma zhig pa yin no //
translated: That dharma which is merely arisen is not destroyed because it is maintained by endurance.

original: de gnas pas des yal bar btang na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnas pas des yal bar btang na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is abandoned by that endurance,

original: gnas par ma byas pa ni nges par rang gi de kho nas mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas par ma byas pa ni nges par rang gi de kho nas mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: it is not maintained by endurance, and it definitely does not endure by its own nature.üîΩThat itself is its destruction.

original: de nyid 'di 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which does not endure.

original: re zhig chos skyes pa gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la ;
analyzed: re zhig chos skyes pa gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la ;
translated: With regard to the statement, ‚ÄúOne dharma that is arisen,‚Äù

original: ji ltar skyes pa de bzhin kho nar 'jig ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa de bzhin kho nar 'jig ste /
translated: it is destroyed just as it arose.

original: 'jig pa dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gcig dang dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gcig dang dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Destruction, endurance, and impermanence are not one thing, nor do they exist as entities.

original: skyes pa la mi 'jig pa med do zhes bya ba khas ma blangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la mi 'jig pa med do zhes bya ba khas ma blangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be stated that one does not accept that what is arisen does not disintegrate.

original: gcig la rga ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gcig la rga ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the statement, ‚ÄúAging, etc., of one thing,‚ÄùüîΩand so on,

original: @248a * // rga ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa dang mthun pa skyes pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur zhing rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: @248a * // rga ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa dang mthun pa skyes pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur zhing rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAging‚Äù is the transformation of a thing that is born into another state, and its change.

original: de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan du mi rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan du mi rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not impossible for that very thing to be transformed into another state.

original: gal te 'di kho na yin na ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di kho na yin na ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If it is just that, how can it be transformed into another?

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ji ltar de kho na ltar yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ji ltar de kho na ltar yin te /
translated: If it is transformed into another, how can it be just that?

original: de kho na bzhin du /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du /
translated: It is just that.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: This statement, ‚ÄúIt is transformed into another,‚Äù is contradictory.

original: gcig kyang gzhan la bltos nas de ltar rnam pa gzhan du yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig kyang gzhan la bltos nas de ltar rnam pa gzhan du yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: One thing is like that in dependence on another, and it is said to be ‚Äútransformed into another.‚Äù

original: dper na nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rjes su 'jug pa'i las la de ltar rnam pa gzhan du yang zhes bstan te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rjes su 'jug pa'i las la de ltar rnam pa gzhan du yang zhes bstan te /
translated: For example, it is like space, which is said to be ‚Äútransformed into another‚Äù in dependence on the activity of following.

original: bdag nyid la bltos nas ni rnam pa gzhan du na zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la bltos nas ni rnam pa gzhan du na zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: But it cannot be said to be ‚Äútransformed into another‚Äù in dependence on itself.

original: de la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in another state.

original: gang yang sde ba gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩ'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gang yang sde ba gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir la /
translated: Other schools say:

original: gnas pa ni rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par gnas par byed pa la de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba dus tha dad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par gnas par byed pa la de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba dus tha dad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are destroyed by impermanence when they encounter the cause of destruction, and because endurance does not cause endurance to endure in dependence on another cause, the activity of endurance and impermanence are at different times.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig na zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'jig pa'i rgyu yod na 'jig pa'i phyir dang / de med na mi 'jig pa'i phyir la ;
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig na zhes bya ba la / 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na 'jig pa'i phyir dang / de med na mi 'jig pa'i phyir la ;
translated: If they are destroyed by that very cause of destruction,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni de yod na ma yin pas mi rtag pa nyid don med par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni de yod na ma yin pas mi rtag pa nyid don med par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: then because they are destroyed when the cause of destruction exists and are not destroyed when it does not exist, and because they are not destroyed when it exists, impermanence is pointless.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ltar de la 'jig par bya ba la nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ltar de la 'jig par bya ba la nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, like the cause of destruction, it is not seen to have the power to destroy them.

original: de bzhin du lha dang 'khru ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha dang 'khru ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said about the gods and the bathhouse.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Regarding the statement, ‚ÄúThe minds and mental factors of sentient beings,‚Äù

original: sde ba gzhan de gzugs ci yang rung ba skad cig mar 'dod pas skad cig ma ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: sde ba gzhan de gzugs ci yang rung ba skad cig mar 'dod pas skad cig ma ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: The other schools maintain that any entity whatsoever is momentary, so nothing at all is nonmomentary.

original: de bzhin du mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yang mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos par 'jig par 'dod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yang mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos par 'jig par 'dod do //
translated: In the same way, they maintain that nonassociated compositional factors and minds and mental factors are impermanent and disintegrate without relying on a cause of disintegration.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag skad cig ma nyid yin pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag skad cig ma nyid yin pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would undermine their position that they are momentary.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid gnas pa bzhin skye ba gzhan nyid la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir bya ba byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid gnas pa bzhin skye ba gzhan nyid la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir bya ba byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the same way, impermanence would function as a cause without relying on another cause, just like endurance.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dag dus tha mi dad par bya ba byed pa thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dag dus tha mi dad par bya ba byed pa thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: And because of that, it follows that endurance and impermanence would function at the same time.

original: sems dang sems las @248b byung ba rnams dus gcig tu gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las @248b byung ba rnams dus gcig tu gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it follows that minds and mental factors would endure and disintegrate at the same time.

original: de lta bas na rgyun la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyun la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the following passage occurs: ‚ÄúThese are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena in a continuum.‚Äù

original: de lta na mdo sde 'di zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na mdo sde 'di zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that case, the following passage from the sutra would be well cited:

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de zhes rgyas par gsungs pa legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de zhes rgyas par gsungs pa legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThese three are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.‚Äù

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams rgyun la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di dag rgyun la bshad pa de ltar ni legs par drangs par 'gyur zhing /üîΩskad cig gi dbang du byas nas bshad na ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams rgyun la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di dag rgyun la bshad pa de ltar ni legs par drangs par 'gyur zhing / skad cig gi dbang du byas nas bshad na ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no contradiction in the arising, etc., of a continuum, the characteristics of conditioned phenomena are explained in terms of a continuum.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not explained in terms of a moment because that would contradict the way they are explained.üîΩMoreover, if arising generates future states, etc.,üîΩthen why does the sutra state:

original: gzhan yang gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa skye ba bskyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa skye ba bskyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is future arising?

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni zhes bya ba la /üîΩrgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par skye ba skyed par byed par mi 'dod la ma 'ongs pa la thams cad la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa cig car yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni zhes bya ba la / rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par skye ba skyed par byed par mi 'dod la ma 'ongs pa la thams cad la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa cig car yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Without causes and conditions,üîΩit is not asserted that arising generates that which is to be arisen without relying on causes and conditions.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig med par yang 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig med par yang 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Nor does the result arise if the assemblage of causes and conditions is not simultaneous,üîΩor if any one of them is absent.

original: ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore not all future results arise simultaneously.

original: skye ba ni gdon mi za bar rang gi sde dang rigs mthun pa'i rgyur sngar skyes pa dang / phyi rol gyi rkyen gyi tshogs la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni gdon mi za bar rang gi sde dang rigs mthun pa'i rgyur sngar skyes pa dang / phyi rol gyi rkyen gyi tshogs la ltos pa yin te /
translated: Undoubtedly arising relies on a cause that is homogeneous and arisen previously and on the assemblage of external conditions,

original: dper na myu gu'i skye ba sa bon dang / zhing la sogs pa rnams la ltos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu'i skye ba sa bon dang / zhing la sogs pa rnams la ltos pa bzhin no //
translated: like the arising of a sprout relies on a seed, a field, and so on.

original: 'o na ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then what is the point of this extensive statement?

original: bskyed par bya ba 'di rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba 'di rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la /
translated: If the assemblage of causes and conditions exists, that which is to be generated arises.

original: med na mi 'byung bas rgyu dang rkyen kho na'i mthu yin par nges par gzung gi skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bas rgyu dang rkyen kho na'i mthu yin par nges par gzung gi skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But since it does not occur when they are absent, it is certain that it is the power of causes and conditions alone, not arising.

original: de yod kyang 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For even when it exists, the effect does not arise.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: skye ba thams cad kyi rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad kyi rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the causes of all arising are the same.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi khyad par skye ba la /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi khyad par skye ba la /
translated: If the cause of the specific future dharma that arises

original: de'i rgyu nye yang ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car mi skye /üîΩ'di ni mtshungs so zhe na 'di kha cig tu mi mtshungs te rgyu'i nus pa mthong ba las 'bras bu med pa ni nus pa ma goms @249a * //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nye yang ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car mi skye / 'di ni mtshungs so zhe na 'di kha cig tu mi mtshungs te rgyu'i nus pa mthong ba las 'bras bu med pa ni nus pa ma goms @249a * //
translated: is present, why do not all future dharmas arise simultaneously?üîΩThis is the same.

original: pa las so //
analyzed: pa las so //
translated: This is not the same in all cases. The absence of an effect from seeing the potency of a cause is due to the non-habituation of potency.

original: dper na 'byung ba rnams las rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skye ba la sngon gyi las la rag las pa'i nus pa rnams mthong bas mig skyed pa lam goms pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba rnams las rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skye ba la sngon gyi las la rag las pa'i nus pa rnams mthong bas mig skyed pa lam goms pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the arising of derivative form from the elements is seen to depend on the potency of past karma, like the generation of the eye faculty through habituation.

original: 'di la btsun pa chos dga' na re /

original: rgas pa zhes bya ba yang rgyun snga phyi'i khyad par la brjod la snga phyi'i khyad par rgyun de yang rnam pa du ma yod pa zhes gong ma bzhin du rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgas pa zhes bya ba yang rgyun snga phyi'i khyad par la brjod la snga phyi'i khyad par rgyun de yang rnam pa du ma yod pa zhes gong ma bzhin du rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: Aging is said to be a difference in the continuum, and the difference in the continuum is said to be manifold, as was said above.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba yang rgyun chad pa la brjod de /
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba yang rgyun chad pa la brjod de /
translated: Destruction is said to be the termination of the continuum,

original: 'dir yang rgya cher snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgya cher snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: and here also it should be said in detail as above.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: gcig la sogs pa'i blo dag kyang thams cad du gzhan nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'i blo dag kyang thams cad du gzhan nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: The cognition of one and so on are not accepted as different in all cases,

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin rigs mthun pa gzhan 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin rigs mthun pa gzhan 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar in type, like the cognition of arising and so on, which excludes others.

original: gcig ces bya ba gzhan las 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba gzhan las 'gyur zhing ;
translated: One is from another,

original: thung ngu dang ring po dag kyang phan tshun bltos pa'o //
analyzed: thung ngu dang ring po dag kyang phan tshun bltos pa'o //
translated: and short and long are mutually dependent.

original: rdul phra rab yod pa la gnas pa'i bltos par bya ba rdzas gzhan bltos she na de bzhin du ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab yod pa la gnas pa'i bltos par bya ba rdzas gzhan bltos she na de bzhin du ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the dependent is a different substance that exists in the subtle particle, then connection and separation are also like that.

original: ma byung ba'i rgyu'i chos yod pa las yod pa nyid dang de bzhin du thams cad gzhan la bltos par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i rgyu'i chos yod pa las yod pa nyid dang de bzhin du thams cad gzhan la bltos par bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the existence of the existent is due to the existence of the cause of the non-existent. In this way, all things are shown to be dependent on something else.

original: chos mngon pa rnams ni 'du byed gang yin pa de dag la de las gzhan pa'i skye ba yod par nam yang mi smra ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa rnams ni 'du byed gang yin pa de dag la de las gzhan pa'i skye ba yod par nam yang mi smra ste /
translated: The Abhidharma masters never say that any formations have a birth that is different from that.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba bltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba bltos pa med pa'o //
translated: The word always means without dependence.

original: de nyid bdag med pa la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdag med pa la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said about selflessness, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang ma skyes pa la bltos nas @251a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang ma skyes pa la bltos nas @251a * //
translated: In the same way, here, in dependence on the non-arisen,

original: skyes ba dang / mi gnas pa la ba ltos nas gnas pa dang ma rgas pa la bltos nas rgas pa dang ma zhig pa la bltos nas zhig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skyes ba dang / mi gnas pa la ba ltos nas gnas pa dang ma rgas pa la bltos nas rgas pa dang ma zhig pa la bltos nas zhig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the arisen is said; in dependence on the non-enduring, the enduring; in dependence on the non-aging, the aging; and in dependence on the non-ceasing, the ceasing.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i skye ba la sogs pa yongs su brtags pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i skye ba la sogs pa yongs su brtags pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the use of postulating a birth, etc., that is something different?

original: skye ba la mi bltos bar 'du byed rnams yod pa nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: skye ba la mi bltos bar 'du byed rnams yod pa nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that formations exist without depending on birth.

original: 'di ni bshad ma thag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni bshad ma thag pa nyid do //
translated: This has just been explained.

original: gal te skye ba med par skye na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gal te skye ba med par skye na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: then that which is arisen would also arise.

original: 'di skad smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad smras par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what he would say:

original: skye ba ni 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyu lhan cig skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: skye ba ni 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyu lhan cig skyes pa yin la /
translated: Arising is the coemergent cause of the arising of formations.

original: rgyu dang rkyen lhag ma rnams ni de'i lhan cig byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen lhag ma rnams ni de'i lhan cig byed pa yin te /
translated: The remaining causes and conditions are its cooperative conditions.

original: de'i phyir gang la skye ba de la de skyed par byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag kyang byed par nus na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la skye ba de la de skyed par byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag kyang byed par nus na /
translated: Therefore, since that which arises is generated by that cause, other causes and conditions are also capable of functioning.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa ste /
translated: But unconditioned states do not arise.

original: de'i phyir de la de las gzhan rkyen rnams kyi byed pa rdugs pas byed pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la de las gzhan rkyen rnams kyi byed pa rdugs pas byed pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the functioning of other conditions is blocked in relation to that, the functioning of arising is blocked.

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba la brjod na /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba la brjod na /
translated: If that which is called arisen is said to be that which has come into being from a state of nonexistence,

original: ma byung ba yang 'dus byas kho na la rigs te /
analyzed: ma byung ba yang 'dus byas kho na la rigs te /
translated: then nonexistence is logical only for conditioned states.

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not exist prior to arising.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rtag tu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rtag tu yod pa yin te /
translated: But unconditioned states always exist.

original: des na de ma byung ba las byung ba ma yin pas mi skye ba yin te skye ba yin te skye ba med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ma byung ba las byung ba ma yin pas mi skye ba yin te skye ba yin te skye ba med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it does not arise from what is non-existent, it is non-arisen, not non-arisen.

original: yang ji ltar chos nyid kyi zhes bya ba chos nyid ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar chos nyid kyi zhes bya ba chos nyid ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang ngo bo'o //
translated: Again, how is it that ‚Äúin accordance with reality‚Äù? Reality is the intrinsic nature and essence of dharmas.

original: 'dus byas kho na skye ba dang ldan par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na skye ba dang ldan par 'dod kyi /
translated: Only conditioned dharmas are accepted as having arising,

original: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin pa gang yin pa 'di la chos nyid las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde ltar skye ba med kyang chos nyid kyis thams cad mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin pa gang yin pa 'di la chos nyid las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no // de ltar skye ba med kyang chos nyid kyis thams cad mi skye'o //
translated: not unconditioned dharmas. In this regard, there is no cause whatsoever apart from reality.

original: zhes bya bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, although there is no arising, it should be accepted that ‚Äúin accordance with reality, all do not arise.‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar skye ba dang ldan par mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar skye ba dang ldan par mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Again, how is it that ‚Äúfrom those that are similar in having arising‚Äù? Form, feeling, etc.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom other conditions than that‚Äù means:

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams ni gzugs skyed pa'i rkyen dag las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams ni gzugs skyed pa'i rkyen dag las gzhan pa ste /
translated: from conditions other than those that produce form.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i rkyen rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i rkyen rnams so //
translated: conditions that produce feeling, etc.

original: de dag las gzhan ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Other than those, etc.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'o //üîΩde yang gang zhig ce na gzugs te tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de dag las gzhan pa de @251b skyed bar nus pa ma yin pa bzhin du skye ba med kyang /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'o // de yang gang zhig ce na gzugs te tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de dag las gzhan pa de @251b skyed bar nus pa ma yin pa bzhin du skye ba med kyang /
translated: Other than those, feeling, etc.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis kyang nam mkha' sogs pa 'dus ma byas skyed par mi nus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis kyang nam mkha' sogs pa 'dus ma byas skyed par mi nus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as those conditions that produce feeling, etc. are not able to produce that which is other than those, so too, even though unconditioned things do not arise, they are not able to produce space, etc.

original: sngar ni rang bzhin nges pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni rang bzhin nges pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin la /
translated: Previously, the existence of arising, etc. was refuted on the grounds that it is impossible for them to exist inherently.

original: da ltar ni nus pa nges pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni nus pa nges pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: Now, it is refuted on the grounds that it is impossible for them to exist through their own power.

original: rdzas kyi ngo bos kyang bkag go //üîΩbye brag smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: rdzas kyi ngo bos kyang bkag go // bye brag smra ba rnams na re /
translated: It is also refuted on the grounds that it is impossible for them to exist substantially.

original: rdzas kyi ngo bos skye ba la sogs pa rnams grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rdzas kyi ngo bos skye ba la sogs pa rnams grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: The VaibhaÃÑsÃÅikas say that arising, etc. exist substantially.

original: de'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sun 'byin pa yod ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa yod ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
translated: and so on at length.

original: gang gi phyir sun 'byin pa la bltos nas grub pa'i mtha' 'dor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sun 'byin pa la bltos nas grub pa'i mtha' 'dor ba ma yin te /
translated: Because a philosophical theory is not to be rejected in dependence upon a refutation.

original: de bas na khyad par yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir du skyon rnams la yang lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir du skyon rnams la yang lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to generate confidence in the distinctions, the faults should be answered.

original: lan bsams pa la 'bad par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lan bsams pa la 'bad par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should strive to think about the answers.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar yang bya'o zhes te skyon med pa'am skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar yang bya'o zhes te skyon med pa'am skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One should also follow a philosophical theory, whether it is faultless or faulty.

original: mtshan nyid rnams bshad zin to /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristics have been explained.

original: // / ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams te ming gi tshogs ni ming gi tshogs so //
analyzed: // / ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams te ming gi tshogs ni ming gi tshogs so //
translated: The collections of names, etc. are the collections of names, words, and letters. The collection of names is the collection of names.

original: tshig gi tshogs ni ngag gi tshogs so //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs ni ngag gi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of words is the collection of speech.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
translated: The collection of letters is the collection of letters.

original: de la ming byed pa ni ming ste zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de la ming byed pa ni ming ste zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Among them, that which performs the function of a name is a name.

original: ming du byed pa ni 'du shes su byed pa ste /
analyzed: ming du byed pa ni 'du shes su byed pa ste /
translated: That which makes a name is that which makes a perception.

original: gang gis 'dir 'du shes par byas te sems las byung ba'i chos de dang de la gzhol bar byed pas na ming ngo //
analyzed: gang gis 'dir 'du shes par byas te sems las byung ba'i chos de dang de la gzhol bar byed pas na ming ngo //
translated: Name is that which causes the mind and mental factors to engage in this or that object.

original: yang na ji lta ji ltar brjod pa de la gzhol bar byed pas don ji ltar gnas pa de dang de dag dang don gyi khyad par dag la sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud gzhol bar byed pas na ming ngo //
analyzed: yang na ji lta ji ltar brjod pa de la gzhol bar byed pas don ji ltar gnas pa de dang de dag dang don gyi khyad par dag la sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud gzhol bar byed pas na ming ngo //
translated: Or else, name is that which causes the mind and mental factors to engage in this or that object, in accordance with the way in which the object is expressed.

original: gzhan dag na re don la mngon par 'jug pa'i yi ge'i gnas skabs ni ming ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re don la mngon par 'jug pa'i yi ge'i gnas skabs ni ming ngo zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that name is the state of the letters when they engage in the object.

original: de ltar na yi ge rnams dang ming tha dad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yi ge rnams dang ming tha dad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the letters and the name are not different.

original: gzhan dag ni ming dang mtshan zhes bya ba rnam grangs te de ni don du 'du shes te ;
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ming dang mtshan zhes bya ba rnam grangs te de ni don du 'du shes te ;
translated: Others say that name and mark are synonyms.

original: der byed pa'i don rnams la bye brag tu bshad pa dang don de gsal bar byed pa yin gyi yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der byed pa'i don rnams la bye brag tu bshad pa dang don de gsal bar byed pa yin gyi yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of mark is that which causes the object to be known, and it is the explanation of the object that is made in that way. It causes the object to be known, but not by its mere existence.

original: yang na bya ba dang byed pa don gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na bya ba dang byed pa don gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the action is not something different from the agent.

original: da yang mang du rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /üîΩji ltar ming gis mtshan nyid kho na byed par shes pa de ltar @252a * //
analyzed: da yang mang du rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste / ji ltar ming gis mtshan nyid kho na byed par shes pa de ltar @252a * //
translated: Moreover, it is said to be a ‚Äúmass‚Äù because it is a collection of many things.üîΩIt is taught that a name is that which causes the understanding of a meaning through the expression of a name.

original: bstan to // 'o na de ltar ming zhes bya ba kho na smos pas chog mod byed pa smos pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: bstan to // 'o na de ltar ming zhes bya ba kho na smos pas chog mod byed pa smos pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If a name is mentioned, what is the point of mentioning an action?

original: byed pa ma smos na sems las byung ba la ming du go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa ma smos na sems las byung ba la ming du go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If an action is not mentioned, a name is understood to be a mental factor.

original: byed pa kho na smos na yang mi ldan pa nyid go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa kho na smos na yang mi ldan pa nyid go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If only an action is mentioned, a non-possession is understood.

original: de'i blo ni sngar gyi don la bya ba byed pas so //
analyzed: de'i blo ni sngar gyi don la bya ba byed pas so //
translated: The mind is directed to the previous object by the action.

original: 'di sa go bar byed cing the tshom med par byed pas na tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di sa go bar byed cing the tshom med par byed pas na tshig ste /
translated: A word is that which causes understanding and removes doubt.

original: de yang ngag kho nas de la the tshom med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ngag kho nas de la the tshom med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is only speech that removes doubt about that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ngag ni tshig ste zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ngag ni tshig ste zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that speech is a word.

original: 'chad par 'dod pa'i bye brag las tshig gi don nges par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'chad par 'dod pa'i bye brag las tshig gi don nges par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ascertain the meaning of a word from the particular that is to be explained, a sentence is mentioned.

original: ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase to the extent that the meaning is completely fulfilled is stated.

original: ming gi don bzhin tshig dang tshig gi don nges pa med do //
analyzed: ming gi don bzhin tshig dang tshig gi don nges pa med do //
translated: There is no fixed rule that the meaning of the name must correspond to the word or the meaning of the word.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid gsal bar byed pas na ming ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid gsal bar byed pas na ming ste /
translated: Among them, a name is that which clarifies its own meaning.

original: gzugs dang sgra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, form and sound.

original: bya ba dang yon tan dang dus dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni tshig ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang yon tan dang dus dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni tshig ste /
translated: A word is that which shows the particular connection with action, quality, and time,

original: sup dang ting gi mtha' can no //
analyzed: sup dang ting gi mtha' can no //
translated: having the suffixes su and tin.

original: de la bya ba dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la bya ba dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Among them, that which shows the particular connection with action is

original: 'tshed do // 'don to //
analyzed: 'tshed do // 'don to //
translated: cooking, reciting,

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: going.

original: yon tan dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni dkar po'o nag po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni dkar po'o nag po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: That which shows the particular connection with quality is white, black.

original: dus dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dus dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa ni /
translated: That which shows the particular connection with time isüîΩcooking, will cook,

original: 'tshed do // 'tshed par 'gyur ro //üîΩbtsos so zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'tshed do // 'tshed par 'gyur ro //üîΩbtsos so zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: cooked.

original: ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa ste zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa ste zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the meaning is completely fulfilled by that.

original: gzhan dag na re mngon par brjod pa gcig kho na tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mngon par brjod pa gcig kho na tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that a single expression is a word.

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces mdor bstan pa gang gis bya ba dang yon tan dang dus dang 'brel pa'i khyad par so sor rtogs par bstan to //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces mdor bstan pa gang gis bya ba dang yon tan dang dus dang 'brel pa'i khyad par so sor rtogs par bstan to //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúAlas, compounded phenomena are impermanent,‚Äù is a brief indication that is a statement that is a specific realization of the distinctions of action, quality, and time.

original: yi ge ni yi ge ste zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yi ge ni yi ge ste zhes bya ste /
translated: A syllable is a syllable.

original: 'dir ram 'dis ming dang tshig gsal bar byed pas na yi ge'o //
analyzed: 'dir ram 'dis ming dang tshig gsal bar byed pas na yi ge'o //
translated: It is a syllable because it illuminates a name or a phrase here or by this.

original: rnam grangs kyis na mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis na mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is a syllable because it is unchanging.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang ldan pa la mi 'gyur ba rnams so /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang ldan pa la mi 'gyur ba rnams so /
translated: The unchangings are in one who possesses the establishment of mindfulness.

analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: yang de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /

analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /

analyzed: de ni sgra'i khyad par don dag la mtshams bcad ba kho nas byed par 'gyur bas 'dir de la tha dad par ming btags pas ci dgos /

analyzed: sgra'i khyad par gyis ming gi khyad par gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin te nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sgra thams cad kyis ming thams cad gsal bar byed pa'am gsal bar mi byed pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //

original: gal te brda la byang ba nges pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brda la byang ba nges pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /

original: de lta na don yod pa nyid kyis @254a * //
analyzed: de lta na don yod pa nyid kyis @254a * //

analyzed: gsal bar byed de /

original: de la brda la byang ba yod pa ma yin pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la brda la byang ba yod pa ma yin pa mi rigs te /

translated: because it is not different from consciousness. Like a reflection, it apprehends the name that is the causal image of the object of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa kho na shes bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid can gyi sgra skyed pa ma yin pas don gsal bar mi byed par 'dod pa ci zhig yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa kho na shes bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid can gyi sgra skyed pa ma yin pas don gsal bar mi byed par 'dod pa ci zhig yin zhes bya'o //

translated: Also, since all the collections of former and later sounds are generated,
