analyzed: de ltar yi ge so so rna ba'i rnam par shes pas dmigs pa rnams phyis rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i stobs kyis rang bzhin mtha' dag dran pa'i yul du gyur pa na brda la byang bas don go ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the individual letters that are perceived by the auditory consciousness are later the objects of memory by the power of the auditory consciousness. When one is skilled in the conventional, one understands the meaning.

original: yi ge de rnams yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge de rnams yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the mere existence of those letters is the cause of understanding the meaning.

original: 'brel pa la byang ba'i dus nyid du yang mtha' dag dran pa'i yul du byas te brda la byang bar byas pas 'brel pa dang mthun par sgra'i don rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa la byang ba'i dus nyid du yang mtha' dag dran pa'i yul du byas te brda la byang bar byas pas 'brel pa dang mthun par sgra'i don rtogs kyi /
translated: Even at the time of becoming skilled in the relation, one makes the totality the object of memory and becomes skilled in the conventional, so one understands the meaning of the word in accordance with the relation.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te 'brel pa don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te 'brel pa don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the relation would be meaningless.

original: gang bshad pa mngon par 'dod pa'i ming la yid bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yang gnod pa can te /
analyzed: gang bshad pa mngon par 'dod pa'i ming la yid bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yang gnod pa can te /
translated: Also, the statement ‚Äúhaving focused the mind on the name that is desired to be explained‚Äù and so on is undermined,

original: sgra mtha' dag yid la bzhag nas phyis rim gyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra mtha' dag yid la bzhag nas phyis rim gyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one focuses the mind on all words and later expresses them in sequence.

original: 'on te ming don dang lhan cig skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'on te ming don dang lhan cig skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Or is the name simultaneous with the object?

original: de la ngag gi bya ba med pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngag gi bya ba med pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The objection is that the name is not simultaneous with the object.

original: de ltar yang ming mngon par gsal ba nyid las mngon par mi gsal ba'i bya ba yod pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang ming mngon par gsal ba nyid las mngon par mi gsal ba'i bya ba yod pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But the name is not simultaneous with the object, because the name is not the object.

original: gzhan du na ngag med ming la 'jug ces pa 'gal te mngon par mi gsal ba ni tshig tu mi 'thad do zhes rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan du na ngag med ming la 'jug ces pa 'gal te mngon par mi gsal ba ni tshig tu mi 'thad do zhes rgya cher bshad do //
translated: Otherwise, the statement ‚ÄúThe name is applied to the object even without speech‚Äù would be contradicted, because the name is not tenable as speech.

original: de lta na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, the past and future object would not have the name.

original: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams da ltar ba ma yin pa de bzhin du ming yang nga ltar ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams da ltar ba ma yin pa de bzhin du ming yang nga ltar ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the past and future arising, enduring, decaying, impermanence, and the arising of arising, etc. are not present, so the name would not be present.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tha snyad kun tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming gis ni don brjod par mi nus te ngag bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tha snyad kun tu 'chad par 'gyur ro // 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming gis ni don brjod par mi nus te ngag bzhin no //
translated: Consequently, the conventions of past and future would be completely cut off.üîΩIn fact, the name of the past and future cannot designate the object, as in the case of speech.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngag gis ni ming gsal bar bya bar mi nus te /üîΩgo rims @256a * //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngag gis ni ming gsal bar bya bar mi nus te / go rims @256a * //
translated: Speech of the past and future cannot clarify the name,

original: bzhin 'gags zin pa'i phyir dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhin 'gags zin pa'i phyir dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already perished or because it has not yet arisen.

original: pha rnams kyi bu dag gis zhes bya ba la /üîΩgcig gis ming ni skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du gcig khan lhan cig skye'i /
analyzed: pha rnams kyi bu dag gis zhes bya ba la / gcig gis ming ni skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du gcig khan lhan cig skye'i /
translated: The sons of the father,

original: rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir du ma ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir du ma ni ma yin pas /
translated: just as birth, etc., are one with the name, but not many, because they are not distinguished.

original: 'dir ming gang gis de dang lhan cig skyes par brjod par bya /üîΩchos 'dus ma byas kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ming gang gis de dang lhan cig skyes par brjod par bya / chos 'dus ma byas kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, by what name would one say that they are born together?üîΩThe name of the unconditioned dharmas,

original: ming ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: would be a non-arisen dharma,

original: 'dus ma byas rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the unconditioned does not arise.

original: tshigs bcad ming la brten pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs bcad ming la brten pa ste /
translated: The verse is based on the name,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: 'dir ldan pa ma yin pa'i ming yod de zhes bya ba'i khungs ni 'di yin te ;üîΩde med na tshigs su bcad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ldan pa ma yin pa'i ming yod de zhes bya ba'i khungs ni 'di yin te ; de med na tshigs su bcad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here is the source for the statement that there is a name that is not associated with a meaning.

original: rten med par ni brten pa yod par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rten med par ni brten pa yod par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: If it did not exist, then there would be no verse, because it is impossible for there to be a basis without a support.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ming la brten pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ming la brten pa bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that a verse is based on a name,

original: de dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa ni zhal gyis ma bzhes te /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa ni zhal gyis ma bzhes te /
translated: but it is not admitted that it is not associated with a meaning.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: don rnams la mtshams byas pa'i sgra ni ming yin la /
analyzed: don rnams la mtshams byas pa'i sgra ni ming yin la /
translated: A name is a sound that delimits a meaning.

original: ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad par yang tshigs su bcad pa yin pas /
analyzed: ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad par yang tshigs su bcad pa yin pas /
translated: A verse is a particular arrangement of names.

original: ming rjod par byed pa ji ltar bkod pa rnams kyis tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba thob pa'i bkod pa de tshigs su bcad pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir bkod pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ming rjod par byed pa ji ltar bkod pa rnams kyis tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba thob pa'i bkod pa de tshigs su bcad pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir bkod pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The particular arrangement is called a verse because it is a particular arrangement of the names that express the meaning, and it is not that all verses are so.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra rnams med pa'i phyir thams cad la brten pa'i dngos por mi rigs pas de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra rnams med pa'i phyir thams cad la brten pa'i dngos por mi rigs pas de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because past and future sounds do not exist, it is illogical that they are things that depend on all.

original: bkod pa'i khyad par yang rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes smos so //
analyzed: bkod pa'i khyad par yang rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is also untenable that the particular arrangement is a different substance.

original: ji ltar zhe na phreng ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na phreng ba bzhin no //
translated: How so? Like a garland.

original: ji ltar phreng ba ni shing ljon pa dang / 'dab chags dang / grog ma la sogs pa rnams phan tshun nye ba na gnas pa las ma gtogs pa'i rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ji ltar phreng ba ni shing ljon pa dang / 'dab chags dang / grog ma la sogs pa rnams phan tshun nye ba na gnas pa las ma gtogs pa'i rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad de /
translated: Just as a garland is not tenable as a different substance from trees, birds, ants, etc., because it exists only in the mutual proximity of those,

original: dpung pa bzhin du de ma gzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpung pa bzhin du de ma gzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is not apprehended, the cognition of it does not exist, like an arm.

original: de lta na yang dpe ni mtshungs te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dpe ni mtshungs te /
translated: Even so, the example is similar.

original: shing ljon pa la sogs pa da ltar ba rnams kho na'i bkod pa'i khyad par las phreng du snyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: shing ljon pa la sogs pa da ltar ba rnams kho na'i bkod pa'i khyad par las phreng du snyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because a garland is measured as a garland from the particular arrangement of only present trees, etc.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi rim pa lta bu'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi rim pa lta bu'o zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúlike the sequence of mind.‚Äù

original: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dus snga phyir byung ba rnams la bar med par 'gag pa dang / skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i rim pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sgra snga phyir byung ba rnams la yang bar mtshams med par 'gag pa dang /üîΩskye ba @256b las ma gtogs pa'i bkod pa'i khyad par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dus snga phyir byung ba rnams la bar med par 'gag pa dang / skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i rim pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sgra snga phyir byung ba rnams la yang bar mtshams med par 'gag pa dang / skye ba @256b las ma gtogs pa'i bkod pa'i khyad par mi dmigs so //
translated: in the same way, there is no interval between the past and future moments of sound, except for the cessation of the former and the arising of the latter.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra rnams kyang sems ltar bkod pa'i khyad par gyi rten gyi ngo bor mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra rnams kyang sems ltar bkod pa'i khyad par gyi rten gyi ngo bor mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, like mind, past and future sounds are not contradictory as the basis of the distinction of arrangement.

original: yi ge tsam zhig zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge tsam zhig zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the phrase ‚Äúmere letters,‚Äù

original: nyes pa chung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyes pa chung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin gyi /
translated: he thinks that the fault is slight.

original: nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ngag las khyad par 'phags pa'i yi ge yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ngag las khyad par 'phags pa'i yi ge yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But because they are not ascertained, it is not the case that letters exist as superior to speech.

original: de dag tu rtogs pa don med pa yin na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag tu rtogs pa don med pa yin na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is pointless to understand them in those terms, then‚Ä¶

original: yi ge dag las ming dang tshig tha dad par yongs su rtogs pa don med do //
analyzed: yi ge dag las ming dang tshig tha dad par yongs su rtogs pa don med do //
translated: It is meaningless to understand that a name or phrase is distinct from the letters.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: yi ge rnams cig car 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir dang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang tshogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir yi ge rnams tshogs pa ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams cig car 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir dang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang tshogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir yi ge rnams tshogs pa ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the letters are not apprehended simultaneously, because they are momentary, and because a collection is untenable, the letters are not the collection of names and so on.

original: yi ge rnams ni rim gyis so so so sor dmigs pa de'i stobs kyis mtha' dag ma 'dres pa'i rim pas gcig tu dran pa'i shes pas shes pa'i yul gyi ngo bor bzhag pa tshogs su bstan par byas pas na 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni rim gyis so so so sor dmigs pa de'i stobs kyis mtha' dag ma 'dres pa'i rim pas gcig tu dran pa'i shes pas shes pa'i yul gyi ngo bor bzhag pa tshogs su bstan par byas pas na 'di la skyon med do //
translated: Because the letters are individually observed sequentially, by the power of that, the collection is taught to be the object of the consciousness that remembers them in order without confusion, and so there is no fault in this.

original: khyed kyang yi ge'i tshogs 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyed kyang yi ge'i tshogs 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: You also assert the collection of letters.

original: 'di ltar bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa /
translated: It is explained like this:

original: shing zhes bya ba 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs pa la brten nas grib mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs pa la brten nas grib mar 'gyur te /
translated: A tree is a collection of primary and secondary elements, and based on that, a shadow arises.

original: 'di nyer len med pa ma yin zhing tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nyer len med pa ma yin zhing tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not the case, and therefore the collection of letters is not a different entity from the letters.

original: yi ge de'i tshogs pa mngon par mtshon pa ni re zhig ming dang tshig gi tshogs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge de'i tshogs pa mngon par mtshon pa ni re zhig ming dang tshig gi tshogs su 'gyur te /
translated: The collection of letters is the basis for the manifestation of the collection of words and the collection of names.

original: don gzhan nyid ma yin par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan nyid ma yin par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a different entity from them.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yi ge tshogs pa med pa'i phyir yi ge'i tshogs pa mngon par mtshon pa dag ming dang tshig gi tshogs dag tu 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yi ge tshogs pa med pa'i phyir yi ge'i tshogs pa mngon par mtshon pa dag ming dang tshig gi tshogs dag tu 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore the Lord Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe collection of words and the collection of names are the basis for the manifestation of the collection of letters. ‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa'i phyir gcig tu brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i phyir gcig tu brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: But they are not the same, because they are not mentioned in the same breath.

original: thams cad btags pa kho nar yod pa dang rdzas nyid du rnam par gzhag par yang ci ltar nus /
analyzed: thams cad btags pa kho nar yod pa dang rdzas nyid du rnam par gzhag par yang ci ltar nus /
translated: How can it be maintained that all exist only as designations and not as real entities?

original: yi ge gcig pa'i ming yang yod do //
analyzed: yi ge gcig pa'i ming yang yod do //
translated: There are names consisting of a single letter.

original: nye bar lan pa'i rdzas gcig ni btags par yod pa dang yod pa'i khyad par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar lan pa'i rdzas gcig ni btags par yod pa dang yod pa'i khyad par yang ma yin no //
translated: A single real entity that is appropriated cannot be distinguished as existing as a designation and as a real entity.

original: rdzas gcig nyid tshogs pa'i rgyun gyis nye bar len pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzas gcig nyid tshogs pa'i rgyun gyis nye bar len pa yin te /
translated: A single real entity is appropriated by the continuum of the collection.

original: 'di gnas skabs kyi khyad par la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnas skabs kyi khyad par la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a difference in terms of time.

original: de la ci ltar yi ge las don gzhan du gyur pa'i ming rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de la ci ltar yi ge las don gzhan du gyur pa'i ming rtogs par byed /
translated: How does a name that is different from a letter make known a meaning?

original: gang bshad pa mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bi bh'a bya ste rtsig pa dang nyi ma'i gzugs bzhin zhes bya ste /üîΩrtsig pa dang nyi ma'i @257a * //
analyzed: gang bshad pa mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bi bh'a bya ste rtsig pa dang nyi ma'i gzugs bzhin zhes bya ste / rtsig pa dang nyi ma'i @257a * //
translated: Because of the possession of the same sound, it is not different, like the wall and the form of the sun.

original: gzugs dag ni so so so sor dmigs te /
analyzed: gzugs dag ni so so so sor dmigs te /
translated: The form of the wall and the form of the sun are perceived separately.

original: 'di yang sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang rtsig pa'i gzugs la nyi ma tha dad du nye bar dmigs te de nyid kyi phyir kha dog tha dad pa'o zhes bya ba ste spros pas chog go //
analyzed: 'di yang sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang rtsig pa'i gzugs la nyi ma tha dad du nye bar dmigs te de nyid kyi phyir kha dog tha dad pa'o zhes bya ba ste spros pas chog go //
translated: And the sun is perceived separately in the form of the wall, which is blue, yellow, red, or white. Therefore, the color is different. Enough of this digression.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, since all phenomena are not the domain of sophistry,

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma las grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma las grub pa yin te /
translated: it is established by the valid cognition of trustworthy scripture.

original: chos kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul kho na yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: chos kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul kho na yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There are some dharmas that are the domain of the wisdom of the TathƒÅgatas alone.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag bshad pa brjod par 'dod pas dri ba byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag bshad pa brjod par 'dod pas dri ba byed pa ni /
translated: The questioner wishes to explain the various aspects,

original: yang ci ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag gang dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang ci ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag gang dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: so he asks, ‚ÄúTo which realms do these collections of names, etc. belong?‚Äù

original: gang dang ldan zhes bya ba ni khams gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan zhes bya ba ni khams gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo which realms‚Äù means ‚Äúto which realms do they belong?‚Äù

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: They belong to the desire realm and form realm alone.

original: gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not belong to the formless realm,

original: de na ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because speech does not exist there.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs med par gtogs pa yang yod mod kyi de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs med par gtogs pa yang yod mod kyi de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say that they also belong to the formless realm, but they are not expressible.

original: gzhan gyis pa'i ngag gis sa gzhan gyi ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dag brjod pa ni ma yin la gzugs med pa dag na ngag med pas brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis pa'i ngag gis sa gzhan gyi ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dag brjod pa ni ma yin la gzugs med pa dag na ngag med pas brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The collection of names, etc. of other stages are not expressed by the speech of that stage. And since there is no speech in the formless realm, they are not objects of speech.

original: gzugs kyi khams su yang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su yang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say: They exist in the form realm in the first absorption, second absorption, etc.

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su yod kyang brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su yod kyang brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say: They exist in the second absorption, etc., but are not objects of speech.

original: sa gang yin pa de'i sa pa'i ngag dang ming ngo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa gang yin pa de'i sa pa'i ngag dang ming ngo zhes bya ste /
translated: Whatever stage they belong to, they are speech and names of that stage.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ngag dang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ngag dang brjod pa ste /
translated: Speech and names of the desire realm are speech and names of the desire realm.

original: rang gi sa pa'i ngag dang ming dang gang zag dang don du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i ngag dang ming dang gang zag dang don du 'gyur gyi /
translated: They are speech and names of their own stage, and they are the person and object.

original: khams gsum pa'i ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not concomitant with the three realms.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i ngag dang brjod pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i ngag dang ming dang don no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i ngag dang brjod pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i ngag dang ming dang don no //
translated: Similarly, speech and names of the first absorption are speech and names of the first absorption and their object.

original: snga ma kho na ltar bsam gtan dang por skyes pa la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: snga ma kho na ltar bsam gtan dang por skyes pa la yang sbyar te /
translated: The former is also applied to one born in the first absorption.

original: gang zag sa gang gi yin pa de'i sa pa'i ming ngo zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: gang zag sa gang gi yin pa de'i sa pa'i ming ngo zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: The name of the level of the person who possesses them is their name.

original: de dag rang gi sa'i ming dang gang zag dang ngag tu 'gyur ro //üîΩrang gi sar 'gyur ba ni gzhan gyis ma yin pa'i don to //üîΩsnga ma kho na ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa rnams gzugs med pa'i khams su brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag rang gi sa'i ming dang gang zag dang ngag tu 'gyur ro // rang gi sar 'gyur ba ni gzhan gyis ma yin pa'i don to // snga ma kho na ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa rnams gzugs med pa'i khams su brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: They are called the collection of names, phrases and letters of that level.üîΩThey are called the collection of names, phrases and letters of that level because they are the collection of names, phrases and letters of that level, not of other levels.

original: der @257b skyes pa rnams la ngag med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag ni sems can du bgrang ba yin te /
analyzed: der @257b skyes pa rnams la ngag med pa'i phyir ro // de dag ni sems can du bgrang ba yin te /
translated: The former is also applied to the collection of names and so on that are not to be called the formless realm because those born there do not have speech.

original: 'gog pa gnyis ma gtogs pa'i sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang rjod par byed pa de dag dang ldan gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gog pa gnyis ma gtogs pa'i sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro // gang rjod par byed pa de dag dang ldan gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are counted as sentient beings because they do not possess the two cessations and they are not counted as sentient beings.üîΩThose who express them possess them.

original: gang brjod par bya ba de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: gang brjod par bya ba de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa 'di gang las she na /
translated: From what source is there this doubt that those who express them possess them and those who are expressed possess them?

original: ming 'di ni don gyi yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa las so //üîΩji ltar ming gi dbang po lta ba po kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: ming 'di ni don gyi yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa las so // ji ltar ming gi dbang po lta ba po kho na yin gyi /
translated: The name is the name of the object.üîΩJust as the faculty of the eye is the seer, but is not seen by anyone else,

original: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gang gi tshe ming rjod par byed pa de'i tshe gang dag dang ldan pa de dag kho nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gang gi tshe ming rjod par byed pa de'i tshe gang dag dang ldan pa de dag kho nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: in the same way, when a name is uttered, it is only the one who possesses the name that is referred to.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir /üîΩrgyu mthun pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: Because they are produced by a homogeneous cause,üîΩthey are only arisen from retribution and not from accumulation,

original: rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin te rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin te rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not a collection of subtle particles.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not arisen from fruition,

original: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they occur at will.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni las kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ming yang las las skyes par smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni las kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ming yang las las skyes par smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Fortunate One said that the name is born from action, because it is the effect of dominance of action.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag kyang yin te /
translated: They are also unobscured non-defined.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa chos dge ba rnams brjod pa na dge ba rnams dang mi ldan la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa chos dge ba rnams brjod pa na dge ba rnams dang mi ldan la /
translated: Therefore, when the roots of virtue are severed, one does not possess virtuous phenomena when they are expressed,

original: de dag gi ming dang ni ldan pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba chos mi dge ba dag brjod pa na zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ming dang ni ldan pa yin no // de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba chos mi dge ba dag brjod pa na zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: but one does possess their names.

original: de bzhin du skal mnyam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du skal mnyam zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, when those free from attachment express nonvirtuous phenomena, it should be said that they do not possess nonvirtuous phenomena when they are expressed,üîΩbut they do possess their names.üîΩSimilarly, homogeneity is only a karmic maturation and not a mere natural outflow, because it is said:

original: skal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: skal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
translated: Homogeneity is the similarity of sentient beings.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir na sems can du ston pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir na sems can du ston pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore it is only a phenomenon of sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir na lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir na lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Since those who have severed their roots of virtue and those free from attachment possess it, it is neutral.

original: de ni rgyu mthun pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi rnam par smin pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu mthun pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi rnam par smin pa'ang yin no //
translated: It is not only a natural outflow but also a karmic maturation.

original: de la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni dper na dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams dmyal ba la sogs pa dag dang skal ba mnyam pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni dper na dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams dmyal ba la sogs pa dag dang skal ba mnyam pa lta bu ste /
translated: Homogeneity born from the cause of karmic maturation is, for example, the homogeneity of hell beings and so on in the hells and so on.

original: lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that they are born with the homogeneity of gods in the desire realm.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni khams dang gling dang mdog dang rigs dang rus dang dge sbyong dang bram ze dang bslab pa la sogs pa skal pa mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni khams dang gling dang mdog dang rigs dang rus dang dge sbyong dang bram ze dang bslab pa la sogs pa skal pa mnyam pa'o //
translated: Homogeneity born from the cause of natural outcome is the homogeneity of realm, continent, color, caste, family, ascetic, brahmin, training and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa chos kyi skal pa mnyam pa ni rnam par smin @258a * //üîΩpa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa chos kyi skal pa mnyam pa ni rnam par smin @258a * // pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Homogeneity of phenomena born from the cause of karmic maturation is born from karmic maturation.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i chos kyi skal pa mnyam pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i chos kyi skal pa mnyam pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Homogeneity of phenomena born from the cause of natural outcome is born from natural outcome.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: sngon gyi las kyis bsgrubs pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa da ltar ba'i sbyor bas grub pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis bsgrubs pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa da ltar ba'i sbyor bas grub pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: That established by past karma born from karmic maturation and established by present application is born from natural outcome.

original: khams kyi dbye bas ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa bltar 'dod pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: khams kyi dbye bas ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa bltar 'dod pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The collection of names, etc. are included in the element of mental objects, and they are included in the three realms, not just the form realm.

original: khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa ste /
translated: The three realms are the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: sems can 'dra ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyang khams gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can 'dra ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyang khams gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three realms are called the realms of sentient beings because sentient beings are born in the three realms.

original: thob rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thob rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Obtained has two types.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyis ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //üîΩlhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //üîΩrgyas pa las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyis ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go // lhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o // rgyas pa las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Those that are born from the cause of karmic maturation are obtained by those born from the cause of karmic maturation.üîΩThose that are not born from the cause of karmic maturation are obtained by those born from natural outflow.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not obtained by those born from enhancement because they are not form.

original: mtshan nyid rnams kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyis ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //üîΩlhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyis ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go // lhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: Those that are born from the cause of karmic maturation are obtained by those born from the cause of karmic maturation.üîΩThose that are not born from the cause of karmic maturation are obtained by those born from natural outflow.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba dag ni med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba dag ni med de /
translated: They are not obtained by those born from enhancement.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la bsags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la bsags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those that are not form do not accumulate.

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The two mindless meditative attainments are the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not karmic maturation because they are subsumed by meditative attainment and the absorptions.

original: rnam par smin pa ni skye ba'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni skye ba'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa kho na yin no //
translated: Karmic maturation is subsumed by the absorptions of birth alone.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba dag kyang ma yin te gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba dag kyang ma yin te gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also not derived from enhancement because they are not form.

original: mi ldan pa ni ma thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni ma thob pa ste /
translated: Nonpossession is nonacquisition.

original: rnam par smin pa'i mi ldan pa ni rnam par smin pa yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i mi ldan pa ni rnam par smin pa yin par mi rung ste /
translated: Nonpossession of karmic maturation is not suitable to be karmic maturation.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gsum ka yang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore these three are derived from the cause of natural outflow.

original: 'di dag gi brjod par bya ba lhag ma zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi brjod par bya ba lhag ma zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa dag gi'o //
translated: The remaining topics of the aggregates, bases, and elements are the obtainment of those, their characteristics, and the non-possession of meditative attainment.

original: lhag ma de yang gang zhig ce na /üîΩthob pa rnams dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag dang mi ldan pa'i sems can du ston pa nyid dang / mtshan nyid rnams kyi sems can du ston pa dang / sems @258b can du ston pa ma yin pa dang / thob pa rnams dang / mtshan nyid rnams kyi khams gsum pa nyid dang /

translated: What are the remaining topics?üîΩThey are the obtainment of those, the meditative attainment of those, the sentient being quality of non-possession, the characteristics of those, the sentient being quality and non-sentient being quality of those, the three realms of obtainment, the three realms of characteristics,

original: mi ldan pa nyid dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa nyid dang / mi ldan pa'i khams gsum pa nyid dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gi dge ba nyid dang / gzugs su gtogs pa nyid do //

analyzed: gzhan du sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir dang ldan pa zhes 'byung bar gal ba med do //
translated: because it is not counted as a sentient being, and because it is not associated with a sentient being, and because the term ‚Äúassociated‚Äù does not occur in the root text.

original: sems can du ston pa nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The presentation of sentient beings has been explained.

original: // / ji ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa nyid bshad ce na /
analyzed: // / ji ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa nyid bshad ce na /
translated: How is virtue, nonvirtue, and indeterminate explained?

analyzed: dge la sogs kyis dge la sogs // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar khams gsum pa nyid dang mi ldan pa nyid bshad ce na /

analyzed: der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa // ma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi //

analyzed: sems kyi rjes 'jug dus dang ni //

analyzed: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

original: sems can du ston pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa yang yin te /

translated: All phenomena means conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir la /
translated: Nirvana is not the active cause of conditioned phenomena because it is incompatible with engagement.

original: lam ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar chos thams cad byed rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: lam ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar chos thams cad byed rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can the path be the active cause of all entities? Because it is incompatible with the arising of the passions.

original: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the active cause of other things because it is present as the nonobstruction of arising.

original: 'bras bu mi skye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The nonarising of an effect is of two types:

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir dang ; gegs byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir dang ; gegs byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absence of a cause and because of the presence of an obstruction.

original: bzlog ste rgyu yod pa'i phyir dang / gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir ni skye ba yin pas gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin par grub po //
analyzed: bzlog ste rgyu yod pa'i phyir dang / gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir ni skye ba yin pas gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin par grub po //
translated: The opposite of that is arising: because of the presence of a cause and because of the absence of an obstruction. Therefore, the active cause is established as being other than the nonobstruction cause.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na skad cig mas bar chod pa med pas 'byung ba'i chos la ni skye bzhin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na skad cig mas bar chod pa med pas 'byung ba'i chos la ni skye bzhin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When causes and conditions are assembled, a thing that arises without interruption by another instant is said to be in the process of arising.

original: zag pa gang dag mi shes pa //
analyzed: zag pa gang dag mi shes pa //
translated: The ignorance of those contaminants

original: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: is the root of all defilements.

original: mi shes pa ni zag pa skye ba gtso ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni zag pa skye ba gtso ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Ignorance is the primary cause of the arising of contaminants.

original: de'i phyir zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la skye ba de dag ni shes pa de la mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la skye ba de dag ni shes pa de la mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, any defilements that do not arise in one who knows them do not arise in one who knows them.

original: shes pas de dag gi rgyu mi shes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pas de dag gi rgyu mi shes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that knowledge eliminates ignorance, which is the cause of those defilements.

original: nyi ma'i 'od kyis kyang skar ma zil gyis gnon pa de'i phyir mig gi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyis kyang skar ma zil gyis gnon pa de'i phyir mig gi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The light of the sun outshines the light of the stars, but it is not the case that the light of the stars does not arise in the field of vision of the sun.

original: de'i phyir 'di las mthong ba mi 'byung ba yin na ji ltar rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di las mthong ba mi 'byung ba yin na ji ltar rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if the light of the stars does not arise from the light of the sun, how could the light of the sun be the active cause of the light of the stars?

original: bshad pa skye bzhin pa ma yin pa la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir byed rgyu zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa skye bzhin pa ma yin pa la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir byed rgyu zhes mi bya ste /
translated: We do not call it an active cause because it exists in the form of an absence of obstruction to that which is not presently arising.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩskye @261a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / skye @261a * //
translated: What is it then?

original: bzhin pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bzhin pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the cause of that which is presently arising.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na bar med par 'byung ba'i chos ni skye bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na bar med par 'byung ba'i chos ni skye bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: A phenomenon that arises without interruption when causes and conditions are assembled is called presently arising.

original: skye bzhin pa skye ba'i bya ba la bltos te de bskyed pa la chos thams cad gegs me byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa skye ba'i bya ba la bltos te de bskyed pa la chos thams cad gegs me byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa yin no //
translated: That which is in the process of arising exists with the nature of not obstructing the generation of that which is in the process of arising in dependence on the activity of arising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'ongs pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du da ltar ba'i ngo bor bya ba la gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir gnas skabs de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'ongs pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du da ltar ba'i ngo bor bya ba la gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir gnas skabs de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, although it is similar in being future, it is called that which is in the process of arising in that state because it does not obstruct the activity of the present.

original: da ltar ba'i dngos po la gegs yod pa ni skye bzhin pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dngos po la gegs yod pa ni skye bzhin pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: That which is in the process of arising does not exist in the present because it is obstructed.

original: gegs byed nus rnams ni zhes bya ba ni dper na zag pa skye ba la shes pa dang / skar ma rnams mthong ba bskyed ba la nyi ma'i 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: gegs byed nus rnams ni zhes bya ba ni dper na zag pa skye ba la shes pa dang / skar ma rnams mthong ba bskyed ba la nyi ma'i 'od lta bu'o //
translated: Those that are able to obstruct are like, for example, knowledge that obstructs the arising of defilements and the light of the sun that obstructs the arising of seeing the stars.

original: dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, nirvana obstructs the arising of all phenomena and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can rnams la ni 'du byed skye ba'i gegs byed par nus pa med de dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can rnams la ni 'du byed skye ba'i gegs byed par nus pa med de dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But for those who are in nirvana and for those who are not subject to origination, the formative forces are not able to act as an obstruction to origination because they are non-existent.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro rnams so //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro rnams so //
translated: The words ‚Äòsuch as the hells‚Äô refer to the hells, ghosts and animals.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni mi la sogs bas res 'ga' gegs byed nus par yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni mi la sogs bas res 'ga' gegs byed nus par yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The words ‚Äòsuch as‚Äô are used in order to include humans, etc. because they are sometimes able to act as an obstruction.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med kyang yod pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du gegs byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med kyang yod pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du gegs byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though nirvana, etc. do not exist, they are not able to act as an obstruction in the same way as they exist.

original: yod dam med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yod dam med kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether existent or non-existent,

original: gegs byed par nus ba gegs mi byed pa dang / byed par mi nus pa mi byed pa'i ngo bor khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gegs byed par nus ba gegs mi byed pa dang / byed par mi nus pa mi byed pa'i ngo bor khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
translated: there is no difference whatsoever in the nature of that which is able to act as an obstruction but does not do so, and that which is unable to act as an obstruction but does not do so.

original: gnyis ka yang de la byed pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang de la byed pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are the same in relation to that.

original: gzhan dag na re chos thams cad phan tshun gegs byed pa'i nus ba yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos thams cad phan tshun gegs byed pa'i nus ba yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: All dharmas have the power to obstruct one another.

original: gang du gcig yod pa der gnyis pa'i skabs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang du gcig yod pa der gnyis pa'i skabs med pa nyid do //
translated: Where one exists, there is no opportunity for a second.

original: gal te gzhan du yang srid na der yang phan tshun go skabs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan du yang srid na der yang phan tshun go skabs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is possible for something to exist elsewhere, then there would be no mutual opportunity there.

original: de ltar chos thams cad phan tshun nges par bzung bas byed rgyu'i dngos por grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad phan tshun nges par bzung bas byed rgyu'i dngos por grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, all dharmas are established as the entity of active cause through mutual determination.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la yang dus dang rten la sogs pa nges par shabd'a nd'a nu pra da na yo ge na b'a /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la yang dus dang rten la sogs pa nges par shabd'a nd'a nu pra da na yo ge na b'a /
translated: Also, in the formless realm, time, basis, and so on are ascertained.

original: 'dir spyir bstan pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir spyir bstan pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, this is a general statement.

original: gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo dang / gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo ma yin pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo dang / gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo ma yin pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to all that is primary active cause and that which is not primary active cause,

original: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya ba bshad pa'o //
translated: it is explained that all are active causes other than themselves.

original: byed rgyu'i gtso po gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas @261b par 'byung ste /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i gtso po gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas @261b par 'byung ste /
translated: The principal active cause is called the active cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya'o //üîΩbyed rgyu nyid la brten nas rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya'o // byed rgyu nyid la brten nas rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is called the active cause.üîΩIt is a cause in dependence on being an active cause.

original: skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is active because it has the nature of generating.

original: gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is a cause because it merely has the nature of not obstructing.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa las /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa las /
translated: For example, in relation to eye consciousness,

original: mig dang gzugs dag dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dag dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: the eye and form are the active cause.

original: de la mig ni nges pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la mig ni nges pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Among them, the eye is the determining cause.

original: gzugs ni rten gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni rten gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Form is the supporting cause.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rjes su gcod do //üîΩrgyu ni sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis mtshungs par ldan pas rjes su 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rjes su gcod do // rgyu ni sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis mtshungs par ldan pas rjes su 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Eye consciousness and so on are the subsequent cause.üîΩThe cause is the cause that maintains through being concomitant in the manner of a seed.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba ni grogs kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba ni grogs kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Coemergent causes are the companion cause.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i yang rten dang gnas kyi rgyu zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i yang rten dang gnas kyi rgyu zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ear, etc. are the cause of support and of abiding.

original: slob dpon gyis ni rten dang gnas kyi rgyu tsam gsungs la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni rten dang gnas kyi rgyu tsam gsungs la /
translated: The Master has stated only the cause of support and of abiding.

original: mdo las phyogs tsam gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las phyogs tsam gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The S≈´tra states only a part of the cause.

original: lus la zas dang zhes bya ba la yang ci zhe na /üîΩbskyed par bya ba la nus pa yod de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: lus la zas dang zhes bya ba la yang ci zhe na / bskyed par bya ba la nus pa yod de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe body is the cause of food‚Äù?üîΩThe meaning is that it is the cause of the production of food, because it is the condition for the arising of food.

original: zas kun 'byung ba las rol sogs pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba las zas kun 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas kun 'byung ba las rol sogs pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba las zas kun 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThe arising of food is from the arising of craving.‚Äù

original: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a sprout, etc. from a seed, etc.

original: sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma dang tshigs 'chas pa la sogs pa ni myu gu dang lo ma dang tshigs 'chas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma dang tshigs 'chas pa la sogs pa ni myu gu dang lo ma dang tshigs 'chas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A seed, sprout, leaf, node, etc. are the cause of a sprout, leaf, node, etc.

original: yang na sogs pa'i sgras gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang na sogs pa'i sgras gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa gsung ngo //
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the form realm, etc.

original: yang mig la sogs pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams la sgrib pa med par gyur pas byed rgyu'i ngo bor brjod pa ci zhen gnyis ga'i byed pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: yang mig la sogs pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams la sgrib pa med par gyur pas byed rgyu'i ngo bor brjod pa ci zhen gnyis ga'i byed pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Again, why are the eyes, etc. described as the efficient cause in the sense of not obstructing the eye consciousness, etc.? Because of their function as both.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the co-originating cause, etc.

original: gal te sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos ma yin na 'o na byed rgyu'i gtso bo de skyed pa la nus pa can gang yin pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gal te sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos ma yin na 'o na byed rgyu'i gtso bo de skyed pa la nus pa can gang yin pa brjod dgos so //
translated: If they are not in the sense of not obstructing, then you must explain what is the principal efficient cause that has the power to generate them.

original: ci ste byed pa po'i ngo bos shen /
analyzed: ci ste byed pa po'i ngo bos shen /
translated: If you say it is in the sense of the agent,

original: 'o na 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: then this should not be stated,

original: gegs med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gegs med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established in the sense of not obstructing.

original: de'i mig la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa skyed pa po nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i mig la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa skyed pa po nyid yin te /
translated: The eyes, etc. are the generators of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: bdun pa'i rgyu gzhan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdun pa'i rgyu gzhan brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other causes of the seventh should be stated.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rnams kyang byed pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rnams kyang byed pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It follows that the co-originating cause, etc. are also the efficient cause.

original: de la 'di ni klan kar mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni klan kar mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: This is not a proper objection.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen yod pa nyid kyis chos rnams la skye ba dang de med pa'i phyir cig car skye bar kun brtags pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen yod pa nyid kyis chos rnams la skye ba dang de med pa'i phyir cig car skye bar kun brtags pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Things do not arise simultaneously, because the conditions for their arising exist sometimes and do not exist at other times.üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúWhy do things not arise from two causes, because the cause is incomplete and because there is an opposing cause?‚Äù

original: @262a * // 'o na rgyu gnyis kyis chos rnams mi skye ste rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir dang 'gal ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: @262a * // 'o na rgyu gnyis kyis chos rnams mi skye ste rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir dang 'gal ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: The cause is incomplete because the conditions for the arising of a thing are not complete.

original: de la ma nges pa ni rang gi rgyu'i rkyen gyis chos gzhan du 'jug pa tsam yin la 'gal ba'i phyir bdag po'i rkyen no //üîΩgang dag skyed par byed pa'i rgyu rnams la yang gegs byed pa yod pa ma yin pa ni rgyu'i ngo bos skye'o //
analyzed: de la ma nges pa ni rang gi rgyu'i rkyen gyis chos gzhan du 'jug pa tsam yin la 'gal ba'i phyir bdag po'i rkyen no // gang dag skyed par byed pa'i rgyu rnams la yang gegs byed pa yod pa ma yin pa ni rgyu'i ngo bos skye'o //
translated: The opposing cause is the dominant condition, because it is the cause of the arising of a thing that is different from the other conditions.üîΩThings arise from causes that are not obstructed, because they arise from causes that are not obstructed by other causes.

original: chos thams cad sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos gegs byed pa med pa ni rgyu rnams su 'dod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos gegs byed pa med pa ni rgyu rnams su 'dod do //
translated: All things arise from causes that are not obstructed by the nature of things, because they are not obstructed by the nature of things.

original: byed pa po'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa po'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: They do not arise from causes that are not obstructed by the nature of the agent.

original: de'i phyir 'di klan ka ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di klan ka ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a criticism.

original: gzhan dag na re gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Others say that not only does it exist as the nature of not obstructing,

original: thams cad skye ba la byed rgyu thams cad nus pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad skye ba la byed rgyu thams cad nus pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: but all causes of arising have the ability to produce all things.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: That which is associated with right view is virtue.
